The Foreign Office warn: Dont take risks with the law abroad or you could end up throwing years of your life away in a foreign prison. Which sounds like pretty good advice, really.

Article.title: Imagine returning home from holiday to find this in your pants
Article.Description: The horror.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 3:45 pm The horror (Picture:Bristol Zoo Gardens/ PA) Ants in your pants are one thing, but giant deadly centipedes!? The bizarre and frightening discovery was made byJennie Esler upon her return home from a holiday in Antigua. The Bristol woman found it hidden in a bag of dirty laundry. It has enough venom to kill small animals and some humans with allergies. MORE: Rupert Murdoch to step down as Fox boss Jennie said: At first I thought I was seeing things and then I peered inside and saw nothing but legs against the black fabric of the bag. He didnt actually run out, he was quite shy. I had to tip him out of the bag into the bathroom sink, as I didnt really know what he was at this point. I couldnt believe it when I saw him. How did he get there? I didnt know what to do so I called the RSPCA who advised me to ring the Zoo and the rest is history. Curtley now has a home at Bristol Zoo in their Bug World exhibit. Mark Bushell, assistant curator of Invertebrates at Bristol Zoo, said: Curtley has settled in well. It is hard to tell whether Curtley is male or female but we do know that he/she likes digging tunnels and particularly likes eating crickets.

Article.title: Rupert Murdoch to step down as Fox boss
Article.Description: The 84-year-old tycoon is ready to hand over the reins to his son James.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 3:24 pm Rupert Murdoch (Picture: Getty) Rupert Murdoch is preparing to step down as chief executive of the media-entertainment conglomerate 21st Century Fox,CNBC television reported. The 84-year-old tycoon is ready to hand over the reinsto his son James. The report cites numerous sources close to the Murdoch family who have confirmed Mr Murdochs intentions. Hewould remain executive chairman of the group with his other son Lachlan as co-chairman in the move this year or in early 2016.

Article.title: Female astrophysicist has a MASSIVE rant about Tim Hunt’s ‘bulls*** misogyny’
Article.Description: She let Sir Time Hunt know exactly what she thought of him.
Article.MainBody: Oliver Wheaton for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 2:53 pm WARNING: Strong language ahead Astrophysicist Sarah Tuttle at work (Picture: Twitter/@niais) An astrophysicist has gone on the rant to end all rants about Tim Hunts bulls*** in light of comments made by the former UCL professor about women in science. Sir Tim Hunt resigned from his position as honorary professor at University College London for saying women cry in laboratories and even accused them of falling in love with male colleagues. Astrophysicist Sarah Tuttle, who says she is heavily salting the garden path of ignorance, has taken theRoyal Society fellow to task and she is holding nothing back.For over an hour Sarah, from Texas, gave Hunt a piece of her mind while tackling the issue of misogyny in the sciences. Heres Sarahs rant in full: "I'm really, really sorry I caused any offence, that's awful. I certainly didn't mean that. I just meant to be honest, actually." Tim Hunt Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Oh hey. It is me again. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Dear Tim Hunt, We knew what you meant, actually. Your honesty is welcome. Do you know what we honestly think? Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 We honestly think that you have no place in science. We honestly think that your attitudes are backwards, draconian, and inappropriate. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 We have fantastic senses of humour. You can tell by the way we are laughing at you. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 We think that belittling other people isn't how science gets done. We think that genitalia has SURPRISINGLY little to do with our work Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 (unless, of course, we are studying sex organs of something or another. Exception made.) Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 We think that we deserve to go to work not to have power wielded over us by sex crazed "professionals" who can't see past our breasts. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 We deserve to go to work and not be talked down to because of the color of our skin. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 We honestly believe that you have no place in the science of 2015. You've held the keys far too long, to be honest. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 I am unwilling to make room for "opinions" where the opinion is I don't get to exist. Sorry. Bored of this bullshit. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 We fight EVERY FUCKING DAY to inhabit the space we were born to inhabit. We spend EVERY DAY convincing others and ourselves. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 The day we get to JUST DO SCIENCE is a fucking godsend and basically the rarest of prizes. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Can we can up with cute hashtags? Can we show pictures of ourselves doing science? THERE IS LITERALLY NO WAY TO NOT UNDERSTAND THIS. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 I am not showing you cutesy pictures. You fucking well know I fucking do science. You can look up my PHD and read it, asshat. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 My tone is not kind. It has been kind for decades. I am old, I am pissed, and I'm not going to adorable my way into justifying my existence. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 MY TONE IS EXACTLY AS FUCKING PISSED AS I AM. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Number of times a day I find my words ignored because apparently it is too confusing those words come from me: Uncountable. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Number of times a day I'm expected to moderate my opinion or tone so someones feelings aren't hurt: Uncountable. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Number of times a day I have to hold someone's dick so they can pee because they have power over me and I hate the splash: UNCOUNTABLE. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 AD BREAK "Your husband is teaching your baby to say "PSYCHO"." My son, just now. #ParentingWin Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 You don't like my tone. No. Stop lying. It is boring. YOU DON'T LIKE ME. It unnerves you. That's cool. I DON'T LIKE YOU EITHER. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 You are a motherfucking impediment to my existence. You make it so I have to explain to my children that "Mommy is a scientist". Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Because even though they see it EVERY GODDAMN DAY it is still special because the world tells them it is. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 I live this reality as loud as I fucking can AND IT STILL DOESN'T OVERCOME THE NOISE OF YOUR BULLSHIT. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 I sit on the floor and I talk with girls in my son's class who run up and hug me because "Are you *REALLY* a scientist??" Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 YES HONEY AND SO ARE YOU. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 And I am SO fucking mad that I have to yell it on the roof tops every day to keep it true for you and me. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 These are my stomping boots. I do not plan on taking them off. I expect to be buried in them. I feel pretty good about that. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 My children just came and hugged me because they could see the steam rising off of my body. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Did me being pregnant ruin anything? Probably. Luckily, there are not many astrophysics emergencies. SCIENCE WAITED. Worlds did not end. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 While I'm here, can we talk about the total failures of Universities to be functional working environment? BECAUSE. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Here we are in places the claim to be LIBERAL BASTIONS of PROGRESSIVE AWESOMENESS. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Do they provide adequate protections for workers? Or are they special exploitative hells? Turns out sometimes both. DEPENDS. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Because actually Universities are more like weird strip malls filled with small businesses where no one is accountable to anyone. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 And money disappears and people don't matter at all. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Which is OBVIOUSLY conducive to everyone doing fantastic and wonderful world breaking science. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 For example My employer, UT? No maternity or paternity leave. Why? THE STATE OF TEXAS HAS MADE IT ILLEGAL. Oops-a-monkey. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 AND I STILL DON'T CRY IN LAB. Honestly, it is a fucking miracle. Plenty to cry about. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Here's what I want. I want us all to start being honest. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Someone asked me recently if I wasn't afraid to be speaking out so loudly, seeing as I am junior. And on the job market. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 And here is the honest truth I am not. Do you know why not? Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 If my opinions threaten or offend you, I want to know it now. I don't want to work with you. I don't want to sit with you in meetings. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 I don't want to spend 30 years trying to prove to you that your way of thinking is fucked up. It is, and you are boring. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 And you can't be much of a scientist if you haven't figured it out by now. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Astrophysics can have me as I am, or can jump off a pier. *MWAH* Kisses! Love, Sarah. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 PS I love all of you. You are why I keep showing up. We are so in this. We are winning. And it is why they keep pouring it on. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 OUR WAY OF SCIENCE IS WINNING. And they are pushing back because they are scared. Ha. Our depths are infinite. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 We build our spaces and we hold each other's hands and we DO IT BETTER. It is too slow for decency but we are moving towards right. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 WE ARE DOING THIS. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 So hold tight, and be merciless, and fight like our lives depend on it. Because let's BE HONEST. They do. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 And fighting is hard. We deserve easier and better, but here is where we are. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 This isn't, by the way, just about white women, although that is what I am. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 I'm throwing these elbows because my white ladyness has gotten me this far. And that is NOT. GOOD. ENOUGH. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 I want room for ALL OF US. I want academia to be cracked open like a ripe peach. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 (this rant interrupted by my nursling toddler who has no respect for twitter momentum.) Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 LET'S DEMONSTRATE TO SOCIETY HOW TO DO IT PROPERLY. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Where was I Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 RIGHT. Here's the thing. I can parade pictures of me in my fancy cleanroom suit (points) or in front of my equipment. And that is great. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 But it is not enough. I look around where are my siblings in science? Where are my friends of color? My trans friends? Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 My success is NOTHING without them. When my friends who are marginalized are still fighting tooth and nail for breath I am still failing. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Me "blazing a trail" is useless if the trail is still on fire behind me, if y'know what I mean. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 I literally can not believe we are still having this conversation about "Women in Science" but somehow we are NOT EVEN HAVING Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 the conversation about "WHY SCIENCE THIS NOMINALLY ABSTRACT INTELLECTUAL IDEA IS SO FUCKING WHITE" Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 So, I'm super proud I'm here, because my ego needs that. But I know me being here is not even a fraction of enough for me. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 We are talking about cis-het men & women in science. THE VERY CONVERSATION EXCLUDES EXCELLENT SCIENTISTS EVERYWHERE. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 As scientists, we should be at the top of the list of "Your words and ideas and visions are what I want to know about." Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 The shape of your body, the color of your skin, your pronouns They make you you, but they don't detract from the weight of your words. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 I WANT TO LIVE IN THAT WORLD. How can we think we're finding diverse ideas when so many of our leaders look IDENTICAL? Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 So let's all be honest. Every time you find a nubbin of power or privilege in your pocket, use it to make someone's day better. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Recognize that speaking truth is an important part of undoing the lies. And listen for all the truths that aren't being heard. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Because right now a lot of truths are not being heard. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 So excuse me for not appreciating Tim Hunt's "honesty". But I've heard enough of his bullshit for infinite lifetimes. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 It doesn't take a nobel prize to be a misogynist git. Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 If you are not here for Tim Hunt's bullshit, I am here for you. Let's build on that, shall we? Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 If you are not here for Tim Hunt's bullshit, I am here for you. Let's build on that, shall we? Sarah Tuttle (@niais) June 11, 2015 Because, like the reionization of the universe, eventually those bubbles of awesome come together AND WE HAVE WON.

Article.title: This is why people drink camel urine
Article.Description: They might need to find something else to quench their thirst.
Article.MainBody: Jimmy Nsubuga for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 1:53 pm You might want to cut down on the camel urine (Picture: EPA) You may have recently discovered people like to drink camel weeafter hearing aboutan outbreak of Middle East Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus (Mers). The deadly condition, which is caused by consuming the urine, has already killed seven people in South Korea. But you maybe wondering why anyone would want to drink animal wee. Some people apparently think it helps them cure their health problems. This is because of a passagein the Hadith (Muslim holy book) that exalts its virtues. Some people of Ukl or Uraina tribe came to Medina and its climate did not suit them,the extract reads. So the Prophet ordered them to go to the herd of (Milch) camels and to drink their milk and urine (as a medicine). So they went as directed and after they became healthy But this could be further from the truth, according toThe World Health Organisation (WHO), which has warned againstconsuming the urine. Food hygiene practices should be observed, WHO said in a statement. People should avoid drinking raw camel milk or camel urine, or eating meat that has not been properly cooked.

Article.title: Man breaks leg while having horse sex for the third time
Article.Description: Cirilo Castillo Jr claims he was hit by a car and sought shelter in a barn.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 1:32 pm The face of a man who likes to pleasure horses (Picture: Hidalgo County Sheriffs office) A man has been arrested for having sex with a horse for the third time. Cirilo Castillo Jr, 45, of Texas, US, broke a leg in his attempt to make love to the animal. Emergency services were called to a barn in Edinburgon February 17 this year after he suffered the injury. Mr Castillo claimed that he was struck by a car and crawled to the barn for shelter, butofficers believe he was kicked by a horse. He was arrested and taken into custody on June 2 and charged with trespass. He has served two sentences for sexual behaviour with a horse.

Article.title: Young boy made to kiss bully’s shoes before he’s kicked in the face
Article.Description: Two teenagers have appeared in court.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 12:49 pm This upsetting footage shows the moment a young boy was made to kiss a bullys shoes before he was viciously beaten. Two teenagers have appeared in court after the video was uploaded to Facebook. A 14-year-old can be heard asking the victim: Do you want a broken jaw? He proceeds to kick him in the face. More than 50,000 people viewed the attack. Part of the shocking video that has landed teenagers in court (Picture: SWNS) The 14-year-old appeared at Swindon Youth Courtand has admitted to one charge of assault. A 13 year-old boy who was also charged is on bail until June 23. A 16-year-old who was arrested with the younger boys was released with no further action. (Picture: SWNS)

Article.title: This is how you troll someone with a ladder
Article.Description: When he does realise he's being fooled he's not too happy.
Article.MainBody: Jimmy Nsubuga for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 12:44 pm This is the last thing you need while trying to get down from a roofin the blazing heat. The poor victim in the video was left flapping his legs like a first time swimmer after his mate decided to play a prank on him. The clip showed the sneaky trickster removing the ladder each time his mate attempted to climb down it. This is one of the best ladder pranks ever (Picture: YouTube/Kidu Videos) When he would get up to see what was going onthe prankster would quickly hide. This happened a few times until his mate finally caught him in the act. He wasnt too happy and hurled his shoes at the jokerwho scampered away. But hopefully he came back as he dropped the ladder in the process, leaving his friend stuck on the roof.

Article.title: FFS. The size of your hand luggage has just shrunk
Article.Description: Leave that extra bikini at home.
Article.MainBody:
Amy Willis for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 11:29 am
(Picture: Getty/ Metro graphics Steven Legere) Chuck out that spanking new Luis Vuitton (okay fake) bag you got for your holiday its now probably way toobig. The size of hand luggage is expected to shrink from 56cm by 45cm by 25cm (ish) to a minuscule 55cm by 35cm by 20cm. On the plus side, this will hopefully eliminate the variety of different size allowances on different airlines. At the moment Easyjet and British Airways allow 56cm by 45cm by 25cm while Virgin Atlantic only allow 56cm by 36cm by 23cm. Ryanair meanwhile only allows 55cm by 40cm by 20cm. Honchosat the International Air Transport Association (IATA) in Miami havedecided that this variation is unacceptable as it causes problems with people changing carriers for connecting flights. So theyve proposed this new tiny size as a solution. Emirates, Qatar and Lufthansa have already indicated that they will sign up to the guidelines with the rest expected to follow suit soon. What do you think? Hand luggage allowance at the moment VIRGIN56cm x36cm x23cm EASYJET56cm x 45cm x 25cm RYANAIR55cm x 40cm x 20cm BRITISH AIRWAYS56cm x 45cm x 25cm DELTA 56cm by 35cm x 22cm AMERICAN AIRWAYS56cm x 35cm x 22cm UNITED 56cm by 35cm x 22cm

Article.title: Christian couple plan on getting divorced in protest against gay marriage
Article.Description: 'Our view is that marriage is a fundamental order of creation. Part of God’s human history.'
Article.MainBody: Matt Payton for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 11:13 am Nick and Sarah Jensen from Canberra, Australia. (Photo Supplied) A Christian couple has saidthat they will divorce if gay marriage is legalised in Australia. Nick and Sarah Jensen, from Canberra, Australia, said they would legally separate but would remain a couple in the eyes of God. MrJensen wrote in the Canberra City News : My wife and I just celebrated our 10-year anniversary. But later this year, we may be getting a divorce. Our view is that marriage is a fundamental order of creation. Part of Gods human history. While the couple have stated they would legally divorce they have said they would continue to be married in the eyes of god, live together and raise their children. Nick Jensen has previously been employed bythe Australian Christian Lobby and now works as adirector of the Lachlan Macquarie Institute, a Christian political organisation. MORE: Vatican official says Irelands gay marriage vote was defeat for humanity A gay rights activist holds a placard during a rally supporting same-sex marriage, in Sydney, Australia (Picture:Reuters) Mr Jensen continued: Marriage is the union of a man and a woman before a community in the sight of God. MORE: Father refused to let his son have his hair cut by gay stylist And marriage of any couple is important to God regardless of whether that couple recognises Gods involvement or authority in it. If our federal parliament votes to change the timeless and organic definition of marriage later on this year, it will have moved against the fundamental and foundational building block of Australian society and, indeed, human culture everywhere. Canberra City News have been widely criticised for publishing this controversial opinionpiece according to news.com.au . Natalie Sarah wrote on Facebook: This is absolutely disgusting, not to mention homophobic. I cant believe such an article was published. You should be ashamed and you definitely owe to gay community an apology. Nick and Sarah Jensen will continue to live together but will no longer by legally married (Photo Supplied) The magazines editor,Ian Meikle said: I think this couple had an interesting angle, and that it was newsworthy. The article does not reflect the opinion of the paper. We published arguments and I decided it was a serious enough argument to genuinely warrant some attention.

Article.title: What are the rules on climbing Mount Kinabalu and why is it so sacred?
Article.Description: Mount Kinabalu is a sacred place for many.
Article.MainBody: Amy Willis for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 11:11 am View from the peak of Mount Kinabalu (Picture: file) To the local community living at its foot, Mount Kinabalu in Malaysia is seen as the resting place of their ancestors. The mountain, the highest between the Himalayas and New Guinea, sits in Kinabalu Park which became a Unesco World Heritage site in 2000. The Kadazan and Dusun communities have long held the mountain as a sacred place. According to the Global Diversity Foundation, locals believe their loved ones must be buried facing the landmark when they die so their spirits can see the mountain as they start their journey to the afterlife. British backpacker Eleanor Hawkins is among five Western tourists arrested in Malaysia for stripping naked on top of a mountain and angering spirits causing a deadly earthquake (Picture: REX) The charity said: Although many have since embraced formal religions, Mount Kinabalu is still a venerated sacred place, a source of their identity and spirituality. Rough guide to climbing the mountain Do not attempt any nakedness The park operates a no trace policy. Do not make a mess. Never climb without a valid permit. Only 146 climb permits are issuedper day. You should aim to stay in the Kinabalu Park or a highland resort prior climb for high altitude acclimatisation Never attempt to catch a flight on the same day of descend as you are likely to miss it The establishment of the park in the 1960s restricted access for villagers, and the mountains popularity with tourists grew. Traveller manual Rough Guides said: Although there are other hikes within the park, the prospect of reaching the summit fires the imagination of Malaysian and foreign tourists alike. Since 2010, an annual pilgrimage has been made by local villagers during which a ritual known as monolob is performed, asking the mountain spirit to keep those who climb it safe. In recent years, efforts have been made to gather knowledge and history from elders to ensure the mountains traditions are not forgotten by the younger generations. (Picture: REX) Mount Kinabalu, which can be seen from the west coast, is revered by locals as aki nabalu or the home of the spirits of the dead. It dominates the 290 square miles of Kinabalu National Park. It sits in a region which boasts powerful ecology, flora and geology. It is named after Sir Hugh Low, a British colonial administrator who made the first climb in 1851. He did not manage to make it to the summit. This was achieved by zoologist John Whitehead in 1888. The summit trail through luxuriant jungle foliage is now a big tourist attraction. A dangerous summit The impressive sights from Mount Kinabalus 13,435ft peak entices tens of thousands of climbers but there is also danger in the beauty. German tourist Victoria Paulsen, 22, died after falling around 100ft down a rocky surface from Lows Peak, the highest point in Kinabalu last year. The weather can make the tough trek, along with any rescue attempt which may have to be launched, more challenging. The body of Briton Ellie James, 17, who was lost in a storm on Mt Kinabalu in August 2001, was discovered at the base of a steep rock face. Rescue teams, who scoured the peaks and gullies around the summit only to be beaten back by tropical storms and by dense swirling mist, had been frustrated by six days of bad weather which hid her location. A threatening mix of lashing rain, gales and temperatures that plunged to below freezing at night made exposure a danger. A 10-man British Army team survived for 29 days after becoming stranded in a narrow ravine in 1994. Rescuers described the soldiers, who had been on a training expedition, as being trapped like a spider in the bathtub. The men were stuck between two giant waterfalls and had written SOS in pebbles . Steep cliffs stopped a helicopter landing and a thick mist from the mountain peak had begun to flood the ravine. Stretchers had to be winched down from the helicopter.

Article.title: Teenage friends electrocuted trying to take selfie on top of train
Article.Description: Olesya Belmasova and Anastasiya Kirillova, both 16, were thrown from the train.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 11:01 am Olesya Belmasovarecovers aftersuffering an electric shock from a live rail line(Picture: CEN) Two teenagersare in a serious condition after they were electrocuted in their bid to take a selfie on top of a train. Olesya Belmasova and Anastasiya Kirillova, both16, wentto a train station in the city of Taganrog in southern Russia. They tried to climb on the tank car of an old freight train that was standing at the platform but didnt realise itwas still in use and on a live track. The pairaccidentally touched the track and were zapped with thousands of volts. A horrified train worker who witnessed the scene said one of the girls appeared to explode. He said: I was walking towards them to ask them what they were doing when they were suddenly blasted to the ground. The pair climbed a train at a station in southern Russia (Picture: CEN) Olesya Belmasovapictured some time before the incident(Picture: CEN) One was completely blackened and the other was on fire as if she had exploded. The pair were taken to a nearby childrens hospital with 70 per cent burns over their bodies and a number of fractures. Anastasia, who was still able to talk, said: We climbed on top of the tank car and then I heard a loud clap.We fell off the car and onto the ground. A witness said one girl seemed to explode (Picture: CEN) My hair was on fire and I was in so much pain. Both girls are said to be in a serious condition. A police spokesman confirmed: They wanted to take some photos from the top of the tank car but were injured by a high-voltage electric current.

Article.title: Deep Blue: Is this our first glimpse of a great white SUPER shark?
Article.Description: She's a colossal 20ft long.
Article.MainBody: Amy Willis for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 10:38 am Snapping her jaws at the crazy human balanced on top of this cage is Deep Blue. Deep Blue who is a colossal 20ft long is believed to be the largest great white shark ever caught on camera. The 50-year-old beastwas filmed in waters near Mexicos Guadalupe Islandafter researcher Mauricio Hoyos Padilla tagged successfully tagged her last year. (Picture: Youtube) Hoyos has now released the footage with the caption: I give you the biggest white shark ever seen in front of the cages in Guadalupe IslandDEEP BLUE!!!. (Picture: Youtube) But do you remember the reports by the Smithsonian Channel of a super shark being responsible for eating a 9ft great white shark Could Deep Blue be our first glimpse at such a beast?

Article.title: Man receives oral sex while blacked out, gets accused of sexual assault two years later
Article.Description: The student was expelled from university following the incident.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 9:57 am The student was expelled in 2013 (Picture: Getty) An student is suing his university for a miscarriage of justice after he was expelled following the verdict of a rape case. The 22-year-old man, who goes by thepseudonym John Doe, was kicked out ofAmherst College in Massachusetts, US, after the disciplinary board had concluded that he forced a female student to performoral sex on him in February 2012. Doe has always maintained that he had in fact blacked out after drinking heavily and received the sex act without any knowledge of it. Two years later, he was accused of sexual assault and found guilty. But now, his lawyer has helped uncover powerful new evidence which proves his innocence yet the college is not re-opening its case. The accuser was the room mate of the woman Doe was dating at the time. A text message sent from herto a friend immediately after the alleged raperead: Its pretty obvi I wasnt an innocent bystander. Then she send another message reading: Oh my God I just did something stupid. Later that evening she invited another male student back to her place for sex. This man has since testified that she seemed friendly, flirtatious, and spirited and not in any way anxious, stressed, depressed, or otherwise in distress. Late last month, Does lawyer, Max D. Stern, filed a lawsuit in US District Court in Springfield, arguing that the college is guilty of a miscarriage of justice against his client. Amherst College statement As the Department of Education and its Office of Civil Rights have made clear, Title IX protects any person attending college from sex-based discrimination, and requires colleges to have in place prompt, thorough and impartial means of investigating and adjudicating claims of sexual discrimination, including sexual violence. The College has put in place a process that is consistent with the requirements under Title IX and is fair to all parties. In this instance, the hearing board concluded that the individual violated the Colleges policies on sexual misconduct and respect for other persons. The College is confident that the hearing board followed the Colleges process in making its decision. More

Article.title: The newspaper letter that proves not everyone is a giant A-hole
Article.Description: It's been warming hearts across the UK.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 9:06 am Changing identity politics in England. Wonderful story pic.twitter.com/ZGK7KPtYPa Sunny Hundal (@sunny_hundal) June 8, 2015 Ladies and gentlemen, we present to you proof that not everyone in this world is a massiveA-hole. The letter appeared in a newspaper and has warmed hearts around the UK. It tells the story of a man queuing to buy a coffee and a sarnie only to be told the card reader was out of action and hed have to get cash. As he prepared to do so, someone behind him piped up and offered to pay. When heoffered to reimburse him, the man replied: If I cannot buy a fellow Englishman a coffee then its a sorry state of affairs. The letter-writeris British Sikh. Mohinder Singh Potiwas note was published in theNewcastle Evening Chronicle under the header Geordies kindness really touched me. The act of kindness took place in Cologne airport.

Article.title: Can you spot a paedophile just by the way someone looks?
Article.Description: Paedophiles tended to be left-handed and have facial deformities, the study revealed.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 7:53 am Misshapen ears are among the traits of paedophiles, according to the study(Picture: PA Wire) We may be able to spot a paedophile just by the way someone looks, a controversial study argues. Scientists believe there are physical differences we can use to identify those who are more likely to commit sex crimes on children such ashaving non-detached earlobes, misshapen ears and being left handed. Fiona Dyshniku, of the University of Windsor in Canada, said: Evidence is steadily accumulating to support a neurodevelopmental basis of paedophilia. If we find that paedophilia has a biological basis, with a very early, even prenatal onset, this will influence and hopefully improve methods of treatment for this group. A total of140 people took part in the study all of which showed signs of distressing or illegal sexual behaviour. MORE: British woman facing jail for upsetting mountain gods with her nudity They were interviewed about theirsexual history and erotic preference. Then their physical features were analysed. The findings suggest that the paedophiles who participated in the study were more likely to have minor facial and head anomalies than thosewho were not paedophiles. Physical irregularities, known as minor physical anomalies (MPAs), can also includehavinga curved fifth finger, a third toe longer than the second toe and an excessive gap between first and second toe. They developwhile the baby is still in the womb and arethought to have a greater impact on the male brain.

Article.title: It’s about to get tonnes easier to switch your mobile phone contract
Article.Description: Ofcom's about to play hard ball with phone providers.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Thursday 11 Jun 2015 7:27 am Its about to get easier to change your contract (Picture: Alamy) We all shudder at the thought of a 24-month phone contract. By the time you come to upgrade theres going to be at least seven new iPhone models and yours will look like a Nokia 3310. But ditching and switching your contracts could be about to get a whole lot easier. Sharon White, Ofcoms new chief executive, is to warn the industry that it must improve its service to customers who still find it too difficult to change provider and cancel contracts. Shes mooting plans to introduce a quality line for broadband on all providers, with customers being able to opt out of the deal if it falls below an acceptable level. Speaking at a conference hosted by consumer group Which?, Ms White will say: When Ofcom was established, access to a reliable internet connection and mobile phone was nice to have. Now it is essential to the functioning of the economy, to the way people work and live their lives. Providers like Vodafone will have to adhere to the rules (Picture: PA) Improving delivery to consumers doesnt just fall at the feet of the regulator. The delivery of first-class communications services is primarily the responsibility of providers. Our job is to ensure that markets work for consumers and citizens, principally by encouraging competition. Where markets dont work well enough or where competition alone isnt enough to secure good outcomes for consumers then we have powers to intervene. She will tell providers that they must improve in four areas by giving consumers better information to help them compare deals, ensuring straightforward switching, adopting clear and fair contracts, and handling complaints better. MORE: Kim Kardashian used to have a MySpace profile and it was so cringe From June 20, a new process will place responsibility for switching between landline and broadband providers who use the Openreach network such as BT, EE, Sky and TalkTalk with the company the customer is moving to. Ms White will say: This will make a real difference for consumers and will encourage more people to take full advantage of competition in the sector. Once this is in place, we will next month turn our attention to improving consumer switching between mobile networks. More

Article.title: Scientists may be able to ‘turn off’ an enzyme to end obesity (in mice)
Article.Description: Like we need another excuse to eat.
Article.MainBody: Oliver Wheaton for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 10:30 pm So far it only works on mice though(Picture: Getty) Its one of the fastest growing pandemics in the world obesity. But now scientists believe they have made a breakthrough which could help reverse this trend by testing, of course, on mice. By turning off a certain enzyme in mice researchers from the German Cancer Research Center found they were able to feed the test mice fatty foods high in calories and yet they did not gain any weight. Not only that, but none of the animals developed diabetes or any other illnesses which often accompany poor diet and excessive weight. Before you gotlooking for a scientist to turn off some of your enzymes so you can stuff you face, be aware that the researchers have only been able to make this work on mice, and have no idea if the same will apply to humans. MORE: Exploding spiders are being found all across Britain The enzyme they switch off is called Kit, and is involved in the development of blood and immune cells, as well as stem cells. Professor Hans-Reimer Rodewald said: We are quite convinced that immune cells play a role in the pathogenic consequences of obesity. But apart from that, little is understood so far about the exact processes that lead to disruptions in metabolism. More

Article.title: Man digging for water finds MASSIVE natural gas reserve instead
Article.Description: This is for everyone who tried to dig their way to Australia.
Article.MainBody:
Metro News Reporter for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 4:39 pm
A man who dug a 70m-deep hole in search of his own personalwater supply struck a huge natural gas reserve instead. Sanya Sanyasiri, 41, was convinced if he went deep enough hed find groundwater he could tap into for his car repair workshop in Thailand. He also fancied having his own privatewater supplyin Mae Sot district in western Thailand. Picture: CEN But after getting down to 70m he noticed gas was streaming out of the hole, and had to insert apipe to fill it up again. Curious by his discovery, Sanya took it to the next level and decided to capture his new find in a plastic bag. Picture: CEN No longer satisfied with just filling the bag with gas, he thought hedtest if itwas flammable by setting it alight. Picture: CEN He then discovered the gas was under high pressure (oops) and had put a special valve on to stop it flooding into the workshop. According to Bangkokpost.comofficials conducted tests on the gas and reported thattrapped samplesburned with a clear blue flame. The burning gas could boil water in five minutes and fry an egg faster than ordinary cooking gas. Authorities have askedSanya to move the gas pipeline, which was in the middle of his garage, to a safer spot to prevent a possible fire. Theyve collected samples for further examination, butdensity checks revealedit is probably methane.

Article.title: This picture is a lasting reminder of the horror of the Germanwings crash
Article.Description: Here's why.
Article.MainBody: Amy Willis for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 4:35 pm A convoy of hearses drives on the highway in Duisburg, Germany (AP Photo/Martin Meissner) Two months after a mentally ill pilot crashed a plane into the side of a mountain, people are still struggling to understand what could have triggered such a shockingact. Among those killedwas a group of 16 schoolchildren, who by a cruel twist of fate caughtthe Germanwing A320 flight on March 24 from Dusseldorf to Barcelona havingalmost missed it when one pupil forgot her passport. The children, who were on an exchange trip to Spain, sent texts hometo their families just moments before the crash telling of their excitement at seeing their families. But they were never to reach their destination. Co-pilot Andreas Lubitz murdered them alongside two teachers and 132 others when he deliberatelylocked his captain out of the cockpit and steered the plane into the French Alps. Today those 16 children and their two teachers finally came home. This picture of their funeral cortege snaking along a German motorway after their coffins were flown into Dusseldorf airport is a lasting reminder of that horror. Something we should never forget. RIP. (Picture: Reuters)

Article.title: These are the top 10 crime hotspots in England and Wales
Article.Description: London's Olympic Park has become a hotbed of crime.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 4:15 pm (Picture: Getty Images) Londons Olympic Park area has become a hotbed of crime, according to new figures. Meridian Square in Stratford was home to 158 crimes in April this year more than any other place in England and Wales. Most of these are defined as theft-related offences. Stats obtained by the Mirror revealed what parts of the UK were subject to the most crime throughout that month. Here are the most crime-ridden places: Top 10 crime hotspots in April 1. Meridian Square, Newham, London 158 2. Stansted Airport, Essex 102 3. Newgate Street, Newcastle-upon-Tyne 88 4. Bluewater Complex, Kent 79 5. Wallis Road, Hillingdon 77 6. Near Debenhams, Market Street 76 7. Westfield Shopping Centre, Hammersmith and Fulham, London 76 8. Piccadilly, Manchester 74 9. West Carriage Drive, City of Westminster, London 62 10. Sheil Place, Liverpool 57

Article.title: Secret filming shows the horrific lives of battery chickens
Article.Description: WARNING: Footage features scenes of animal cruelty.
Article.MainBody: Oliver Wheaton for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 3:27 pm WARNING: Footage features scenes of animal cruelty Its no secret the food industry is pretty grim behind theproduction lines, but this footage takes it to new lows. The Humane Society of the United States took this secret footage of battery farmed hens and the horrific conditions they are forced to live in. The chickens are allegedly owned by Costco for egg production. Among the horrific sights in the video are dead birdsbeing pounded into flattened pancakes by other chickens as their bodies are left in the cages, and henswith feathers missing and covered in what look like sores, crammed into tiny cages in the pitch black warehouse. MORE: Rabbit manages to survive running through an avalanche The HSUS say these conditions are not only inhumane, but also create a health hazard for humans consuming eggs, claiming that confining birds to cages in this manner increases the risk of salmonella. They also accuse Costco of misleading the consumer by emblazoning their egg cartons with images of chickens happily living outside on green pastures. Calling animal abuse the standard practise of the food industry, they ask consumers to put pressure on Costco to end battery farming of their chickens. (Picture: The Humane Society of the United States/Youtube) More

Article.title: Dannemora prison break: Woman ‘helped inmate escape because he has a big penis’
Article.Description: 'When he's cleaned up, he’s very handsome and, in all frankness, very well endowed.'
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 2:55 pm David Sweat (L) and Richard Matt (R) (Picture: New York State Police) A female prison worker who is being questioned over the escape of two killers may have done it because one is very well-endowed, suggested a retired detective. Richard Matt, 48, and David Sweat, 34, broke out of jail over the weekend by using power tools to tunnel through the walls ofClinton Correctional Facility in Dannemora, 20 miles from the Canadian border. They left a note behind with a smiley face and the words: Have a nice day. Joyce Mitchell has been interrogated and retired detectiveDavid Bentley told the New York Post Matt has a way with the ladies. He said: When hescleaned up, hes very handsome and, in all frankness, very well endowed. He gets girlfriends any place he goes. Joyce Mitchell has been questioned by police (Picture: Facebook) Officials are believed to have taken the tool from a nearby construction site. They blasted through a number of walls before snapping off a lock to open a manhole cover on a street more than a mile away from the prison. The acting state corrections commissioner, Anthony Annuci, said: A search revealed that there was a hole cut out of the back of the cell through which these inmates escaped. The note left by two murderers(Picture: New York State Governors office) They went onto a catwalk which is about six stories high. We estimate they climbed down and had power tools and were able to get out to this facility through tunnels, cutting away at several spots. To add to the cinematic nature of their escape, Governor Cuomo stated thatthe men had even arranged their beds so it looked like people were sleeping.

Article.title: ‘Last ever footage of Amelia Earhart’ is discovered
Article.Description: Speculation as to how her the aviation pioneer's last flight ended continues to this day.
Article.MainBody: Oliver Wheaton for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 2:37 pm This film may be the last footage of pioneering aviatorAmelia Earhart before her fateful final flight. Experts are split on when the footage was actually taken, with some believing it was shot in March 1937, moments before setting off on her first soloround-the-worldattempt which ended prematurely when her plane crashed. Others claim it is from May of that year, just two months before Earhart set out on her final voyage making it the last footage ever taken of her. Filmed on the runway atBurbank Airport (now Bob Hope Airport) in California, the footage shows Earhart smiling and posing on her plane, the Lockheed Electra L-10E. Earharts plane famously disappeared over the Pacificoceanshortly after setting off fromNew Guinea. Speculation as to how her flight ended continues to this day.

Article.title: The most ridiculously expensive school trips parents have felt pressured to pay for
Article.Description: Should school trips be capped?
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 1:32 pm Are parents paying too much for school trips? (Picture: Getty) Every year parents are put under pressure to fork out large sums for school trips. A debate over whether or not educational establishments should cap the costof excursions has been re-ignited afterHorsforth School in Yorkshire asked parents to pay1,650 for a week-long sporting trip to Barbados. The plan was criticised for segregating families who cant afford to send their children away. This #Horsforth #schooltrip at 1650 highlights that most schools seem to think that money grows on trees. They have no link with reality. Tim Wallis (@TimWallis1969) June 9, 2015 Whether it's prom nights or foreign trips, ALL schools need to rethink the impact they have on budgets of less well off families #Horsforth George Marshall (@George_GOWYC) June 9, 2015 But it probably wont surprise you toknowthats not the most expensive school trip to have ever been mooted. Here are a few othersthatll make your eyes water and wallet whimper in pain. Netball and hockey tour to Australia 4,500 (Picture: Getty) Parents of studentsat Epsom College were asked to fork out the hefty sum for this trip, or two other trips at the time each totalling more than 3,000. But not enough parents signed up so it was cancelled. Biology trip to South Africa 3,000 (Picture:Two Oceans) I mean, this one doessound awesome: One week in an elephant sanctuary followed by another deep sea diving. The trip was organised byHeathside School, a state school in Surrey. Sports tour to Singapore and Malaysia2,050 (Picture: Nicky Loh/Getty Images) An Essex school invited its students on a sports tour toSingapore and Malaysia in August 2014. Parents were given two years notice for the 12-night trip. Drama trip to New York City 800 (Picture: Getty) An interesting view from a teacher who posted about his/her experience on Mumsnet . I used to work in an area with a much more mixed demographic. A really deprived area right near a much more affluent one. That college ran an annual NY trip for four days costing 800. I went on it in my first year there. Totally pointless. One theatre visit, one tv studio, then sightseeing (empire state, statue etc). Most of the girls spent all their time in Bloomingdales. For less than 100 we could have gone to a show in London and visited a tv studio here. To be fair to schools The trips do offer unforgettable and exciting experiences which are, ultimately, educational in one way or another Where they can, schools will help finance the trips Theyre not compulsory Staff give up their time to help out and volunteer Teachers carry the heavy burden of being a parent as well Share your story Whats the most expensive school trip youve felt pressured to pay for? Share your story by tweeting @MetroUK or emailing oliver.mcateer@metro.co.uk Parents faced with extravagant school trip costs be like: (Picture: Imgur)

Article.title: Every dog owner will recognise this look of betrayal
Article.Description: Warning: Adorable dogs alert.
Article.MainBody: Metro Reporter for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 12:35 pm Look of betrayal (picture: Twitter/JasmineMilton_ snowdog.guru) Dogs can convey their feelings of betrayal with just a look and this Siberian husky has got it down to a T. Theres theclassic game owners play where they pretend to throw the ball and watch as their loyal petgoes in search of the faux find. But owner Jasmine Milton, 18, took it one step further when she tricked Anukoby actually throwing the ball and then catchingit herself. Cheeky. Student Jasmine, of Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire, tweeted snapsshowing herSiberian beauty was having none of it. She said: Hes a real character.Despite his very hostile expressions though, hes a sweetheart. Everybody who meets him agrees hes a softy and likes attention.

Article.title: Man’s house raided over leaked naked Jennifer Lawrence pictures
Article.Description: Rhianna, Kate Upton and Anna Kendrick were also victims of the mass nude pic leak.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 12:21 pm Actress Jennifer Lawrence was a victim of the leaked photos (Picture:Joel Ryan/Invision/AP) FBI agents have raided the home of a man who is alleged to have leaked nude photos of celebrities as part of The Fappening. Jennifer Lawrence, Rhianna and Kate Upton were all targeted in the mass leak last summer. Official FBI documents nameEmilio Herrera whose IP address was allegedly used to hack more than 500 iCloud accounts, reports Gawker . Special Agent Josh Sedowskywrote: Based on victim account records obtained from Apple, one or more computers used at [Herreras house] access or attempted to access without authorisation multiple celebrities email and iCloud accounts over the course of several months. The IP address accessed more than 330 iCloud accounts (Picture: Getty) The IP address on Narragansett accessed 330 unique iCloud accounts between May and August 2014, according to the other. Of those, 291 allegedly belonged to people who registered their accounts outside Illinois. Those 291 accounts were accessed more than 600 times. The document lists othervictims by initials who are believed to beAbigail Spencer, Christina Hendricks, Hope Solo, Jennette McCurdy, Olivia Wilde, Anna Kendrick, Emily Browning and Amber Heard, Gawker adds. The mass leak was branded The Fappening a slang term for masturbation and play on apocalypticmovie The Happening. Several computers, hard drives and phones have been confiscated from the Chicago home since the raid on October 16 2014. Mr Hererra has not been charged with any crimes. The FBI has declined to comment.

Article.title: Father refused to let his son have his hair cut by gay stylist
Article.Description: 'If you are racist, sexist, homophobic or an a**hole...don't come in.'
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 10:37 am Hairdresser Richard Evans, left, with owner Russell Hughes outside their store (Picture: Daily Post Wales) Just when you think societys embraced homosexuality,some bigot pipes up. A man refused to let a stylist cut his sons hair because he was gay. Outrage ensued, obviously, and Russell Paul Hairdressing in Prestatyn, Wales, has had enough. Owner Russell Hughes has put up a sign in his window reading: If you are racist, sexist, homophobic or ana**holedont come in. The 49-year-old said: It was a normal busy day at the salon when a man calledin with his wife and child, who must have been about ten-years-old. MORE: Racy no gay sex sign appears at dogging hotspot They erected this sign after the incident (Picture: Daily Post Wales) The man came up to me at that point and said Im not being funny but didyou just say that lads going to cut my sons hair. He then said well I assume hes gay and I dont want him cutting mylads hair so could you do it, to which I said no because Im gay as well. Russell said the man stood up and left without another word, but theexchange left staff shocked. Afterwards, Russell posted about the incident on the salons Facebook page,attracting a huge response from enraged customers and members of thecommunity.

Article.title: Suicide bomber blows himself up at Egypt’s famous Luxor tourist site
Article.Description: Casualties unknown.
Article.MainBody: Amy Willis for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 10:34 am Tourists point out the hieroglyphic on columns in the Hypostyle Hall at the Karnak Temple in Luxor, Egypt(AP Photo/Hassan Ammar, File) A suicide bomber has blown himself up at one of Egypts most famous tourists spots. Officials say there is no immediate word on casualties from the late morning attack. The bomber attacked the ancient temple of Karnak in Luxor, a southern city frequented by millions of foreign and Egyptian tourists every year. They say police have foiled two other suicide attacks also targeting the Nile-side temple, one of the countrys main tourist attractions, rivalling the pyramids at Giza. Early news of Luxor bomb suggests complex op bearing hallmarks of IS loyalists. Haven't managed mainland significant attack since Jan 2014. Louisa Loveluck (@leloveluck) June 10, 2015 MORE SOON Atourist points out a hieroglyphic on a column in the Hypostyle Hall at the Karnak Temple in Luxor(AP Photo/Jon Gambrell, File) More

Article.title: Alton Towers rollercoaster crash victim Leah Washington stands up for first time after amputation
Article.Description: Leah Washington's leg was amputated after The Smiler crashed last week.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 10:05 am Leah Washington had her leg amputated after the crash (Picture: Leah Washington/Facebook) A teenager who had to have her left amputated after the Alton Towers rollercoaster crash has stood up for the first time. Leah Washington, 17,from Barnsley, South Yorkshire, was one of four seriously injured when a carriage on The Smiler crashed into an empty one on Tuesday last week. She was taken into intensive care after she was trapped on the ride for more than four hours. Her left leg was taken off above the knee and her condition has dramatically improved. Speaking to the BBC, Leahs brother Luke said: She was heavily sedated. She was in intensive care and the machines were keeping her going. Emergency services battle to free those trapped on The Smiler (Picture: Pixel) Yesterday I walked into the room and she was standing up. It was great. Each day has gone by and shes improved and improved.I dont know where shes got her strength from. Leah was on a date with Joe Pugh when the crash happened. Vicky Balch, 20, from Leyland in Lancashire and Daniel Thorpe, 27, from Buxton, Derbyshire, were also seriously injured. Alton Towers has admitted full responsibility for the crash in letters to the victims and their families. Free tickets were given out to those who went to the theme park in the days after the crash (Picture: PA)

Article.title: Snappy! This teenager’s toilet was blocked and they found a giant iguana inside
Article.Description: Snappy.
Article.MainBody: Amy Willis for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 9:58 am SCROLL DOWN FOR VIDEO Lily Lindquist (Picture: YouTube) When 17-year-old Lily Lindquist usedher toilet and went to flush the chain she was surprised to find it blocked. She called in her mother Marian, who produced a very robust plunger. It failed. Eventually the family, who live in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, were forced to call in professional help in the form of plumber Ailsa Scott. The toilet looked innocent enough (Picture: YouTube) Ailsa, who has been a plumber for 12 years, used an industrial unblocker to dislodge the clog and was shocked to discover a giant slithering IGUANA. Ailsa doing her thing with the toilet (Picture: YouTube) Ailsa said: To my surprise, I pulled out that large iguana. At first I thought it was a toy, and then it started moving around. Ive never seen anything like this before. This is the first time I pulled something like that out of a toilet. This is what she pulled out. Actual picture. (Picture: YouTube) The plumber believes the iguana made it into the toilet through a vent on the roofof the familys house. Stunt iguana. Not the iguana involved. (Picture: YouTube) Lily has now made sure the vent is firmly closed. She said:I dont want to be there when an iguana flies out of the toilet or an iguana bites me when Im trying to go to the bathroom. Lily and Marian Lindquist (Picture: YouTube) Unfortunately, the poor thing didnt make it and died shortly after his ordeal. Lilys mother said: We didnt want the iguana to die. We did not know the iguana was there.

Article.title: Policeman quits after pool party video of him pushing over black teen and brandishing gun
Article.Description: David Eric Casebolt's actions are under investigation.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 9:03 am A police officer in Dallas has resigned after he was recorded pushing a black teenage girl to the ground outside a pool party and brandishing his gun at others. Officer David Eric Casebolt was out of control and his actions were indefencible, though he was not pressured to quit, McKinney police chief Greg Conley said after the officer submitted his resignation. The video was posted online after officers responded to calls on Friday and it quickly went viral. The 41-year-old former Texas state trooper and ten year veteran of the McKinney force was put on administrative leave after the incident. Conley said a review of the video showed that our policies, our training and our practices do not support his actions. MORE: Officer suspended after pulling gun on unarmed teens at pool party Teenagers run away from the policeman brandishing a gun (Picture: YouTube) Casebolts actions are under investigation and no decision has been made whether charges will be filed against him, Conley said. Charges of interfering with an officer and evading arrest against the only man arrested during Fridays incident have been dropped,he added.

Article.title: Victims of sexual violence are using these images on Facebook in a global campaign
Article.Description: Seen these on your feed recently?
Article.MainBody: Thelma Ds (@thelmadis8567) June 9, 2015 My support to the survivors in Iceland & all around the world! Raise your voices! #konurtala #ggun #outloud pic.twitter.com/tNopp1mnzU Sandra Wiehle (@Memoire_neuve) June 8, 2015 @EmWatson have you heard of this? I am so incredibly proud of Icelandic women!! #ggun #konurtala pic.twitter.com/I9JVtfJpck MALEFICENTISBAE (@Unndis00daisy) June 2, 2015 Writer Andrea Eyland Sleyjar-og Bjrgvinsdttir has shared her story of sexual abuse before. She said:I was very ashamed for having landed in such a situation and had very little self-esteem. I think this is the beginning of a revolution. Reading these stories encourages other women to come forward and tell their story. They have to know they have nothing to be ashamed about. We need to tear down the wall of silence, which serves no purpose but to defend perpetrators of sexual violence. Beauty Tipsfounder slaug Mara Agnarsdttir says she gets hundreds of new members every day. Only women are allowed to join, but the campaign has spread to other social media groups which encourages men to share their stories as well.

Article.title: Guide dog throws himself in front of bus to save owner’s life
Article.Description: Cats: Up your game.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 7:58 am Cats: Up your game. This dog literally threw himself in front of a bus to save the life of his owner. Golden retriever Figo was crossing the street with his blind ownerAudrey Stone, 62, when she stepped out into the path of an oncoming vehicle in New York, US. With limited options the dog chose to take the impact of the bus and was crushed under a wheel suffering injuries to three legs, CBS reported. Figo saved the life of his owner (Picture: CBS) Audrey was struck too and suffered a fractured elbow and ankle and is in hospital recovering well. Audrey said: I thank him. I thank God that I have him and that he survived too. I love him. I want to get home to my dog. Audrey is recovering well in hospital (Picture: CBS)

Article.title: Creative people more likely to suffer from mental health issues
Article.Description: The theory is displayed among famous people throughout history such as painter Van Gogh.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 10 Jun 2015 7:27 am The theory is displayed among famous people throughout history (Picture: PA) Scientists have found a link between creativity and mental health issues. They say artistic types with unusual jobs and more likely to have genes that causes problems like manic depressionthan those with standard jobs. The theory is displayed among famous people throughout history such as painterVan Gogh. More than 250,000 people were studied as part of the Icelandic research which was published inthe journal Nature Neuroscience. They found people who had creative careers like acting were more likely than others to carry the genes linked to mental health issues. Van Gogh suffered from self-destructive behaviour(Picture: AP) This was compared to the genes of those with average careers like salesmen. Lead researcher, Kari Stefansson, of genetic research firm deCODE, said: We are using the tools of modern genetics to take a systematic look at a fundamental aspect of how the brain works. The results should not be a surprise because to be creative you have to think differently from the crowd.

Article.title: 102-year-old finally gets her doctorate after being prevented by Nazis
Article.Description: She waited 80 years because it was 'impossible' under Nazi law.
Article.MainBody: Metro News Reporter for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 9 Jun 2015 6:54 pm Ingeborg Syllm-Rapoport shows her doctoral certificate (Picture: EPA/BODO MARKS) A 102-year-oldhas become Germanys oldest recipient of a doctorate today after waiting 80 years because her thesis was blocked by the Nazis. Studying at university can feel like it is taking decades and sometimes you wish you could have an extra day or two to finish an essay. But be careful what you wish for because Ingeborg Syllm-Rapoport had been waiting since 1938 to officially complete her PhDdue to her Jewish heritage. After the Nazis came to power they expelled Jews from educationand many professions. Ingeborg Syllm-Rapoport arrives with the dean of Hamburgs UKE University Medical Center, Uwe Koch-Gromus(Picture:AFP PHOTO / DPA / BODO MARKS) Ingeborgcleared the final hurdle by passing an oral exam then finally received her doctorate at the University of Hambury to come aneonatologist (specialist in caring for newborns). In 1938 her supervisorwrote in a letter he would have accepted her work on diphtheria if it hadnt been for the Nazis race laws which, he said, make it impossible to allow Miss Syllms admission for the doctorate. After the Nazis came to power in Germany in 1933, they gradually disenfranchised Jews, expelling them from universities, schools and many professions, before eventually deporting and killing them in death camps across Europe. Medical director of the universitys hospital Burkhard Goeke said: After almost 80 years it was possible to restore some extent of justice. More

Article.title: Terminally ill six-year-old given honorary high school diploma
Article.Description: Jordan even got to attend the graduation ceremony.
Article.MainBody: Oliver Wheaton for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 9 Jun 2015 6:42 pm Jordan Plantiz getting a hug for him mother (Picture: AP) A terminally ill six-year-old boy has been given an honorary diploma from a local high school during their graduation ceremony. Jordan Planitz suffers fromMPPH (Megalencephaly, Polymicrogyria, Polydactyly and Hydrocephalus) a rare and terminal neurological syndrome. While it is unlikely little Jordan will see his own graduation, kind students at theTri-City High School in Illinoisinvited him along to their ceremony. They had gotten to know Jordan during the principal for a day initiative started by the now ex-principal Dustin Day, which allowed sick children to come in and act as the schools head for a day. Jordans mother, Deanna told ABC News : Jordan was invited, and we went and met the most amazing senior class that youll ever come across. They took care of him all day, surrounded him going up and down stairs. It was a wonderful experience. Jordans has cogitative difficulties due to his illness and has trouble walking up and down stairs. MORE: Joker sticks zipper onto his scar after having brain tumour removed Flanked by three senior students, Jordan took to the stage to receive his honorary high-school diploma during the ceremony. Students rose to their feet and applauded as the smiling youngster gleefully grasped his scroll wearing a gown and even mortarboard. While Jordan was delighted with the honour, mum Deanna, who wept as her sonsname was announced, described watching him receive it as a bittersweet experience. I was watching all of these high school students getting up, receiving their diplomas and sitting down and knew that I wont have that, she said. All Jordanknew that day was that he was on stage and everybody was standing and clapping for him.It was one of the most tearful and emotional days of my life. More

Article.title: Two killed after pushing suicide bomber away from mosque
Article.Description: The men were reportedly standing outside a mosque in Dammam, Saudi Arabia
Article.MainBody: Nicholas Reilly for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 9 Jun 2015 4:33 pm This video shows the moment that two men pushed their suicide bomber cousin away from a crowded mosque only moments before all three were killed when the bomb detonated. In the clip, which was posted on Instagram, the men are purportedly standing outside a mosque in Dammam, Saudi Arabia, with the bomber disguised as a woman. But the two men are suddenly seen frantically pushing the man away, only seconds before an explosion is seen, resulting in the deaths of four people. The bomber can be seen disguised as a woman (Picture: Instagram/YouTube) In a statement, Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack and named the bomber as Abu Jandal al Jizrawi, claiming he managed to reach his target.

Article.title: How NOT to get bitten by mosquitoes this summer
Article.Description: 1. Don't have smelly feet
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 9 Jun 2015 3:50 pm (Picture:Getty Images) Mosquitoes. Theyre the things of nightmares and must be stopped at all costs. But until we haveNASAs handheld midgie vaporising gun, we can only follow these tips courtesy of Dr John Bairdof theCollege of Life Sciences and Medicine at Aberdeen University. 1. Dont have smelly feet (Picture: Getty) Dr Baird told Metro.co.uk: Females are attracted to the various chemicals we give off and our smelly feet produce many chemicals, so having clean feet or rubbing some peppermint moisturiser in may help. 2. Dont wear shorts (Picture: Barcroft) Because most importantly, theyre a terrible look. But as above, it makesthose flying needles more likely to smell your sweet chemicals. Dont give them an open goal. 3. Dont wear thin clothes (Picture: REX) Believe it or not, some mosquitoes can actually bite you through your clothes *shudders in disgust*. DrBaird explained: Day-biting mosquitoes like Aedes that spread Dengue are really hard to deal with and covering up is a good option, but they can and do bite through thin clothing. 4. Have amazing genes (Picture:Getty Images) Mosquitoes use carbon dioxide to detect us. As they fly aimlessly upwards CO2 emitted by us as we breathe out pushes them downwards thus giving them direction. Our metabolic rate measures how much CO2 we give off, and some have higher rates than others. Those people are big midgie magnets and should be avoided. 5. Use a fan This is obvious, right? Surely those spawns of Satan are no match for the mean metal choppers currently in your loft. 6. Dont drink Its sad, but true. Drinking alcohol has been proven to attract more of the blighters in several studies. However, experts are still trying to figure out why exactly. 7. Wear light clothes Colour is important when mosquitoes get all up in your personal space. They find it harder to see light clothes so clad yourself in white and become a walking shield. 8. Dont sweat The rumours are true theyre attracted to body heat. It goes back to CO2, and we expel more of it when were hot. 9. At night, get into this obvious routine: CLOSE YOUR WINDOWS. DrBaird said Malaria mosquitoes bite at nightbut are alittle easier to ward off and the most effective way by far is to close windows and sleep under an insecticide-treated bed net. More

Article.title: Teenager carries disabled brother on his back for 57 miles
Article.Description: By the end he said he had a 'sore back', unsurprisingly.
Article.MainBody: Oliver Wheaton for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 9 Jun 2015 2:42 pm Hunter and Braden received a huge amount of support (Picture: AP) A teenager has just completed an epic 57-mile journey while carrying his younger brother on his back. Hunter Gandee, 15, completed the entire walk with eight-year-old Braden strapped to hisback with a harness to raise awareness for cerebral palsy. Braden suffers from the condition and cannot walk on his own. The pairstarted their journey from Lambertville, near their home in Michigan. Setting out on Friday, together they reached the finish line 57 miles away this Sunday, with Hunter saying he had a sore back. (Picture: The Cerebral Palsy Swagger/Facebook) MORE: Dog walker is accused of trading a dog for drugs Not only was Hunter raising awarensss for the condition, but also for The Cerebral Palsy Swagger , an organisation set up by the brothers and their family. So far they have raised enough money to create a playground in Bradens school through their fundraising efforts. Hunter said by undertaking his walk he and his brother were able to reach more people. Thats what our goal was, he added. At the end of the trek Hunters football team were waiting to dunk a bucket of cold water over his head. This isnt a one off for Hunter and Braden. Last year Hunter completed a 40-mile walk again with Braden fastened to his back. More

Article.title: Luckiest man alive narrowly escapes being crushed to death
Article.Description: Man is nearly crushed to death by ferry as he prematurely ejects himself on to shore
Article.MainBody: Metro News Reporter for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 9 Jun 2015 12:46 pm Any commuter running late for work knows how frustrating it is waiting for public transport to roll up to the platform so you cangetoff. Sometimes it feels like it is taking FOREVER for the train doors to open. Youre told to mind the gap and you feel like an Olympic long jumper leaping across the Amazon River. This man takes it to a whole new level with his failed Greg Rutherford impressionas he jumps off a moving ferry. Crushing escape(picture: Youtube/Finest Pupil) He misjudges the distance (weve all been there) and prematurely throwinghimself onto the shore only to slipin the sand and begin to tumble down into the water below. Fortunately he seems to survive the ordeal and is able to dust himself down.

Article.title: Mother wearing ‘YOLO’ top orders her son to punch woman in shocking supermarket fight
Article.Description: The little boy stamps on the shoppers head as his mother grapples with her on the ground.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 9 Jun 2015 12:30 pm A physical fight in a supermarket is nothing too shocking, but this is next level. The five-minute clip shows two womenwrestling in the aisle of a Walmart in Indiana, US. They roll around on the floor and repeatedly swipe at each other as onlookers film and do nothing to stop the fight. Then one of the women whos wearing a top that reads you only live once orders her son to punch the other in the face. Hegrabs what appears to behairspray cans and shampoo and throws them athis mothers contender before stamping on her head. Local police were called and succeeded in breaking up the fight, according to local news sources, although it is not clear ifanyone involved was arrested or charged.

Article.title: This note from the wife of a stroke victim will tell you the vital symptoms before it’s too late
Article.Description: Her cautionary tale is definitely worth taking on board.
Article.MainBody:
Search Metro Follow us This note from the wife of a stroke victim will tell you the vital symptoms before its toolate Nicholas Reilly for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 9 Jun 2015 11:23 am Jodie Niven wrote a heart-rendering note about her husbands condition (Picture: Jodie Niven/Facebook) The wife of a stroke victim has written a heartfelt note about her husbands condition in a bid to outline the tell-tale symptoms that could prevent others from suffering a similar fate. Jodie Niven, from Sydney, Australia, was left devastated when her husband suffered a stroke almost a year ago. But in an insightful Facebook post , which has received over 200,000 shares, Jodie explained the symptoms that her husband experienced and warns people to look out for the signals. Scroll down for the post in full. A CT scan of a stroke victims brain
Jodie Niven recalls her husband's stroke In a few weeks it will be 1 year since my 41 yr old husband, and our 4 and 6yr olds Dad had a stroke. While we generally made the choice to deal with this privately, today I have noticed a number of people sharing an article on a new sign of stroke. It is, sadly, very indicative of the lack of public knowledge about strokes that this information is being shared as a new sign. I have done a quick search and noted internet reports of this particular story as far back as 2004. Thats 11 years ago! So I feel its time to put some first hand knowledge out there (please feel free to share) When my hard working, frequent traveling husband arrived home from work one Friday evening: He didnt mentioned that he was home later than expected because his pinky and ring finger on his left hand just kept hitting the wrong damn keys, and he had to keep re-typing his emails. He didnt mention that hed stumbled for no apparent reason when walking to the bus stop from work. He didnt mention that the reason he knocked on the door at home to get in was that he had fumbled and dropped the keys a number of times while trying to open the door. He did mention that he felt like he was getting the flu. He did mention that he felt like he was having a hyper sensory experience when walking down the dark nature reserve pathway on his way home from the bus stop, with feelings of a heightened sense of hearing. He didnt have a headache. He initially seemed, to me, to be getting the man flu, and nothing more. He almost made the worst decision possible, in suggesting he would go to bed early and sleep, after we had gotten the kids to bed, but thankfully (!) is such a workaholic he decided to send one more email. About 2 hrs after arriving home from work (still *not* having mentioned the weird, mis-typing fingers, stumbling on the way to the bus stop, or dropping the keys at the door), he stood up from the dining table where he was working, to go upstairs to bed. His foot turned in an ever so slightly strange way, and he did the slightest stumble, but I saw it out of the corner of my eye. Thankfully: I did stop and ask him what was that about, are you ok? He told me his foot had just gone to sleep. I did stop him and tell him wait a minute, that was unusual, and get him to walk across the lounge room. Everything seemed fine. But he had stumbled, when there was nothing to stumble on. I did make him walk over and sit on the lounge. He walked normally. He looked normal. He was speaking normally. I did get him to put both his arms straight out in front of him. He held them perfectly level, and then, ever so slightly, the left hand dropped down lower, only a few centimetres. My subconscious said stroke. My brain said couldnt be. I told him to put his arms down, then lift them and do it again. Again, he initially held his arms level, then the left hand dropped and curled ever so slightly. I did get him to hold his arms up straight above his head. Initially both arms stayed up, then his left arm pulled slightly down, and his hand turned slightly. I did stop him from going to bed. I made him stay put, sitting down. I did fight every part of my no nonsense its nothing, just get on with life upbringing and attitude and I did call an ambulance. As disbelieving as I was, I realised that it might be (probably was) a stroke, and every second mattered. By the time I had given our details to 000, and was speaking to the operator while waiting for an ambulance, my husband had gone from looking and speaking fine, to not being able to control his fine arm movements very well, or speak as clearly as he normally would. It was only as the ambulance arrived that he started to show the classic signs of a stroke. The drooping face (but nowhere near as pronounced as the stroke awareness literature at this stage), trouble speaking, and significant loss of limb movement. You may have heard that doctors can reverse stroke damage if patients get to hospital soon enough to clear the clot within a few hours. This refers to an Ischaemic stroke, where a blood clot has blocked an artery and cut off blood flow, and can be true, but this comment discounts the extraordinary rehabilitation and effort that can still be required by patients to get back to a normal physical existence. In this instance, my husband had an Intracerebral haemorrhage, which occurs when a blood vessel within the brain bursts, allowing blood to flow into the brain. The only thing that could be done in this instance was to do everything possible to reduce his blood pressure, wait, and hope.
