Due to the very early intervention, and the extensive knowledge and understanding of neuroplasticity at St Vincents hospital Sydney (surprisingly, something which has only gained significant and broad medical acceptance within the last 5-10 years), my husband, and we his family, have been some of the lucky ones. After being in Intensive Care, and then the Stroke Ward, my husband worked hard with his amazing rehabilitation team, and he was able to build new neural pathways to compensate for damaged areas of brain. He learnt to walk again. He learnt to use his arm again. He learnt to speak clearly again. He is back at work. Many stroke patients will never live any semblance of the life they led before the stroke. Children, teenagers, and people in their twenties and thirties can also be, and have been, changed forever by stroke. If you notice the slightest strange incident, or physical behaviour in yourself, or in others, including an unusual trip, or slight change in coordination of fingers, stop. Stop for a minute and ask them to smile, to poke their tongue out, to hold their arms out in front of them, and above their head. Ask them to repeat a sentence. Name five things and ask them to repeat them back to you. If everything seems ok DONT let them go to bed, keep an eye out for small changes. If there are signs of stroke, no matter how minor, CALL AN AMBULANCE. There is a joke in my family that you would literally have to hit me over the head and knock me unconscious to get me into an ambulance, let alone call one, and I realise now that had it been me experiencing the symptoms, I would have ignored them. I would have gone to bed. I would be dead. Be self aware, as well as caring for others. Recognise early signs and save your life or someone elses. My husband has been very, very lucky. But he is still changed forever to those who know and love him. **Thank you to those of you who have cared enough to take the time to share this, and increase awareness. I am stunned that this post has now been shared by over 1,650 people, reaching over 160,000 people around the world. Hopefully our story will help someone, somewhere, recognise what can be early signs of stroke, they will act FAST, and another life will be saved. *In Australia, 1 in 6 people will have a stroke. Stroke is Australias second single greatest killer after coronary heart disease and a leading cause of disability. One in five people having a first-ever stroke die within one month and one in three die within a year Support for stroke victims can be found from the Stroke Association . More

Article.title: Isle of Wight Festival weather: You’ll need to pack wellies – but there’s sun as well
Article.Description: Perfect fest conditions.
Article.MainBody: Follow us Isle of Wight Festival weather: Youll need to pack wellies but theres sun aswell Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 9 Jun 2015 10:27 am A bit of rain and sun for the weekend surely perfect festival weather (Picture: Met Office) Uh-oh thats not the picture any Isle of Wight festival goers wanted to see. Revellers excited to bask in the glow ofacts like Pharrell Williams, Paolo Nutini and The Prodigy over this weekend should definitely pack wellies (but youve been dying to break out those Hunters anyway, havent you). June 11 to 14 will see a mixed bag of weather. The fest will kick off with dry and fine tent-pitching conditions on Thursday. But rain is due to dominate Fridaybefore clearing up again for Saturday and Sunday. Temperatures look set to remain anywhere between 16 and 21C throughout the entireweekend. Theres a mixed bag of weather from Thursday to Sunday (Picture:Zak Hussein/Getty Images) Bring sunnies and wellies (Picture:Tim P. Whitby/Getty Images) Biffy Clyro at last years festival (Picture: Dave J Hogan/Getty Images) More

Article.title: Drinkers are ignoring the new Magaluf bans brought in after girl gave head to 24 men
Article.Description: Revellers poured out into the streets and police were called to break up fights.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 9 Jun 2015 8:58 am Tourists walk on the street at the resort of Magaluf, in Calvia town (Picture: AP Photo/Joan Llado) Tough new rules cracking down on drunken behaviour came into force in Magaluf last night but everyone ignored them. The measures include a ban on drinking alcohol on the street between 10pm and 8am and restrictions on the Majorcan towns notorious bar crawls. Itcomes after a teenager from Northern Ireland caused a furore last summer when she performed sex acts on 24 menin a club game. Some bars along the Punta Ballena strip had signs up with messages such as no alcohol permitted in the street and drink with moderation. But no-one cared. Plenty of holidaymakers spilled out of bars with drinks in their hands. Scuffles broke out and half a dozen police cars intervened to control youths singing football chants. MORE: Party girl gives oral sex to 24 men in Magaluf for a 2 bottle of cava This picture of a woman passed out was well circulated last year when the furore was ignited over blowjob gate (Picture: PA) Hannah MacDonald, 19, a mental health nurse from Perth in Scotland, said: Were here for a reason, were here to get f****** mortal and just love life, were not here to worry about drinking on the street, I do enough of that in Scotland. Fine me, do whatever you want, Im going to get mortal on the street and I dont care. The new rules say bar crawls must be accompanied by a company rep and accredited security staff, and reps are also required to have first aid training. All crawls now require at least seven days notice to be authorised and the number of participants is limited to 20 per crawl, with companies only permitted to run one a night. MORE: Magaluf boss of blowjob gate bar crawl spared jail after beating up girlfriend Bar owners say the rules are a token gesture and will lead to a negative impact on the tourist industry (Picture: PA) Those running businesses in and around the strip complained about what they described as a token gesture from Calvia town hall to clean up the resorts image. Juan Pedro Leon, 56, an owner of the Office bar on the strip, who has been working in Magaluf for more than 30 years, said the new rules could spell the end for its tourist industry. Mr Leon said: What is the harm in letting people on to the street with drinks if they take them out in plastic cups? Its still early in the season, but if the police do take a heavy-handed approach that is going to put people off coming here. That could lead to the loss of up to 1,000 jobs for the local economy. More

Article.title: Someone made a laser beam shotgun that burns through stuff
Article.Description: Don't try this.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 9 Jun 2015 8:17 am Someones actually made a frickin laser beam that burns through stuff. The mad scientist-type person rounded up materials anyone could easily get hold of to make the weapon. He said he made the beam because it wasnt illegal and wrote in the description: The output of this laser is complete insanity, and is made up of eight parallel 5W laser beams totaling to 40W. The parallel beams are manipulated with lenses, sort of like how a choke modifies the spread of a shotgun blast. The massive diode array is powered by a huge lithium polymer battery pack (capable up dumping 250A) and the laser array is regulated by a whopping 24 LM317 drivers.

Article.title: Kid filmed driving family car in rush hour
Article.Description: It's not the strangest thing we've seen, but it's up there.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 9 Jun 2015 7:55 am Wait a second, theres a kid driving that car. The bizarre scene was captured on camera in Phoenix, US, during rush hour. It shows a family car pull up and stop at traffic lights with a young boy behind the wheel. Come on dude, youre going to get someone killed, the man recording can be heard saying. As the video comes to an end the kid moves from the drivers seat and swaps with an adult who, you know, actually has a licence.

Article.title: Possessed kitty toy is petrifying
Article.Description: Evil courses through its stuffed innards.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 9 Jun 2015 7:43 am Many of todays problems faced by kids can be blamed on this petrifyingcat toy. My Bouncin Kittylures us in with a false sense of security its bug-eyed stare and cute little pink bow. But beware, for evil courses throughits stuffed innards. If provoked itll descend into an unholy rage thatll spark night terrors of a severe magnitude. There is no hope for the youth of today. Pretty pricey too.

Article.title: Alton Towers bosses face paying out millions in compensation for Smiler rollercoaster crash
Article.Description: The park has accepted full responsibility for the incident.
Article.MainBody: MORE: Four seriously injured in Alton Towers Smiler rollercoaster crash involving 16 people In March 2009 he helped 13-year-old schoolgirlAgnes Collier win a record payment when she suffered spinal injuries and her mother was killed in a car crash. Nick Varney, CEO Merlin Entertainments said: We are deeply saddened by the news about Leah and all our thoughts are with her and her family. We cannot undo the events of last week but everyone in the company and at Alton Towers is determined to do all we can to provide appropriate support to those who were injured and their families. Alton Towers re-opened yesterday for the first time since the incident (Picture:Joe Giddens/PA Wire) Alton Towers' latest statement Since the accident of last Tuesday we have done our best to provide appropriate communication and support to those involved and to their families. We absolutely recognise what a difficult time this is for everyone, especially those who have been so seriously injured, and we have tried to do this in a way that is both sensitive and appropriate Over the course of the weekend we have written again to all of the 16 people involved or to their families. These letters were all hand delivered by Alton Towers representatives. Irrespective of the outcome of the current investigations into the causes of the accident, in these letters we have accepted full responsibility to those who had been injured in the accident and confirmed that we will ensure that compensation will be provided to them. We have recommended each of the injured guests or their families instruct a lawyer and submit a claim for compensation which we will ensure is dealt with swiftly and sensitively. In addition we have engaged the services of Health and Case Management Ltd (HCML) a leading firm of specialist independent rehabilitation providers to provide all of those involved with the best support for their individual needs whether from the NHS or by providing additional support and services. HCML has already made contact with some of those affected in order to progress this. More

Article.title: Dog walker is accused of ‘trading a dog for drugs’
Article.Description: He claimed the dog went missing after he suffered 'an unexplained psychotic episode'.
Article.MainBody: A photo posted by Morgan Bogle (@freedomofanimals) on Jun 2, 2015 at 5:22am PDT A woman who has been desperately searching for her dog since Februarynow believes something truly harrowing has happened to him. Morgan Bogle hired caretakerTommy Doerr to walk her 4-year-old rescue dog Sugar in New York City earlier this year, however Doerr claimed to have suffered an unexplained psychotic episode, during which the dog seemingly escaped. Following a social media campaign under the hashtag #FindSugarNYC, Morgan became more suspicious of Doerr and has now filed a law suit against him, claiming he either traded the dog for drugs or sold it for drug money. In the lawsuit Bogle claims Doerr was detained by the police who had allegedly searched him and found him in possession of a controlled substance, believed to be PCP. One of the posters Morgan put up around New York (Picture: Instagram) The papers go on to allege that Bogle was told that Doerr traded her dog for the drugs. Bogle is now requesting that Doerr coughs up $10,000 (6,500) damagesor returns Sugar. Despite the claims the NYPD say no arrests have been made regarding the case. More

Article.title: Homophobic letter writer has got his analogies all confused
Article.Description: If you're going to be homophobic, at least make an effort to sound convincing.
Article.MainBody: Nicholas Reilly for Metro.co.uk Monday 8 Jun 2015 5:33 pm (Picture: Twitter) If youre going to use an analogy to support a bigoted, backward, homophobic viewpoint, then its at least worth ensuring that said analogy makes perfect sense to illustrate your point. But that wasnt the case when a reader called Jan wrote into Melbournes Herald Sun newspaper. The recent vote to legalise gay marriage in Ireland has sparked renewed debate about the same taking place in Australia and Jan wasnt having any of it. Theywrote: When I was a kid at school, we were taught about the birds and the bees. Not the birds and the birds or the bees and the bees just saying. But theyreso wrong because surely the inter-species breeding that hes seemingly promoting is actually the kind of diversity that hes against? This little guy understands Jan though, and thinks that a nice big furry hug might just make him feel a little less angry. More

Article.title: 8 times criminals were trolled by their victims
Article.Description: After outsmarting the would-be thief she frightened him off with her screams
Article.MainBody: Metro News Reporter for Metro.co.uk Monday 8 Jun 2015 4:21 pm Recently a woman saved herself from being mugged by throwing her purse over some railings after being accosted by a biker. Maribel Hernadez heard themotorbike pull up alongside her as she was about to walk into her flat but as she turned the rider leaped offand beganrunning towards her. Without pausing for a second she chucked her bag, jacket and keysbehind the metal fencingin Ituzaingo, Buenos Aires. The potential mugger was thrown and instead jumpedback on the motorbike empty-handed. Shes not the only would-be victim who hasbamboozled a bandit. Here are seven of our favourite moments when underdogs have come up trumps: The trouser whip A man who appears to be hasslinga young woman gets his comeuppance when his trousers are whipped down within seconds by a good Samaritan leaving him half-starkers on a train. Too quick for them In March this year a bravecyclist chased muggers who had assaulted a 53-year-old man and taken his bike . The trio legged it down a road in Leyton, East London, but were forced to ditch the goods as theheroclosed in. The old foot in door problem An alleged shoplifter was caught outwhen he was outsmarted by his victims whotrapped one of his legs in the door. One half of the crime-fighting duo grabbed his foot while the other leaned against the door and with a free hand called the police. Even more satisfying is the reaction by onlookers refused to help the offender make his escape despite his pleas. The Hilary Swank This young lady channels her inner Hilary Swank in The Next Karate Kid to battle off her would-be attacker. Groping revenge Meanwhile in Russia awaitress unleashed a world of hate on this customer who thought it was okay to grope her. Forgetful thief Afterthreatening the woman with a weapon, this robber ranoff with the ladys bag forgetting to take his scooterwith him. Using their strengths against them Most people would be terrified if a shotgun-wielding thugtried to mug them late at night. This brave man snatches the weapon and chases the robber down the street. More

Article.title: Baby koala bear hugs mum during life-saving surgery
Article.Description: It’s a picture that’s warming hearts around the world. The baby koala and his mother were hit by a car in Queensland, Australia, over the weekend. Lizzy and Phantom were taken in to Australia Zoo where she underwent life-saving surgery to fix a collapsed lung. Her baby miraculously escaped unscathed – and clung to her […]
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Monday 8 Jun 2015 4:19 pm Koala Lizzy and her little one Phantom (Picture: Australia Zoo) Its a picture thats warming hearts around the world. The baby koala and his mother were hit by a car in Queensland, Australia, over the weekend. Lizzy and Phantom were taken in to Australia Zoo where she underwent life-saving surgery to fix a collapsed lung. Her baby miraculously escaped unscathed and clung to her the entire time she was operated on. Lizzy made it through the procedure and is recovering well. Phantom hasnt left her side since. Phantom clung to his mother throughout the entire operation (Picture: Australia Zoo)

Article.title: There’s nothing good about these bullfighting pictures
Article.Description: You don't have to be an animal activist to feel for this poor bull. WARNING: Contains distressing images
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Monday 8 Jun 2015 4:13 pm Warning: Distressing images Blood gushes from a bull during a fight with Spanish matador Rafaelillo at the Ventas bullring in Madrid (Picture:REUTERS) You dont have to be an animal activist to feel for this poor bull. The incredible image shows blood gushing from the beasts nose during its last minutes in the Ventas bullring, Madrid. The series of snaps show Spanish matador Rafaelillo driving a sword into its back. At one pointRafaelillos assistant appears to get gored. And when the bull is finally put out of its misery, the fighter looks emotional. A sword is driven into the bulls back (Picture: REUTERS) The bullfighters assistant is gored during the event on June 7 (Picture: REUTERS) The matador appears emotional after killing the animal (Picture: REUTERS)

Article.title: Gentle hippos help out tiny duckling trapped in a pond
Article.Description: Coming this summer, the family-friendly board game: Helpful helpful hippos.
Article.MainBody: Oliver Wheaton for Metro.co.uk Monday 8 Jun 2015 3:44 pm Hippos might look like comical oafs, but they are in fact extremely aggressive, and have been known to capsize small river boats and maul people to death. Obviously these kindly hippos are of a different mindset. Things didnt look good for this duckling who fell into the hippo pond inBlijdorp Zoo, Holland. Amighty hippopotamusapproachesthe bird as it flaps around, trying to escape the water. However rather than gobble him up, the hippo tries to nudge the little fella back onto land. Get back here and let me help you! (Picture: TheSchizoDuckie/Youtube) Before long another hippo gets in on the act, and together they are able to save the terrified bird. Hippos are primarily herbivores, but are known for their aggressive and territorial behaviour. They kill roughly 300 people a year in the wild, but clearlysaw no threat from this little duckling. More

Article.title: B&Q worker pushes trolley home for elderly couple so they don’t have to carry compost on the bus
Article.Description: Ed Stubbs. You're our kind of man.
Article.MainBody: Search Metro Follow us B&Q worker pushes trolley home for elderly couple so they dont have to carry compost on thebus Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Monday 8 Jun 2015 3:34 pm Eds good deed was pictured and uploaded to Kents Spotted Facebook page (Picture: Facebook) Ed Stubbs. Wow. Youre our kind of man. When the B&Q worker served two elderly customers faced with hauling heavy bags of compost on the bus home, he went above and beyond. The 26-year-old earned at least 71 Good Human Points when he pushed their trolley all the way home for them. Mr Stubbs, from Hythe in Kent, told the Daily Express: One of the men had a mobility scooter and planned to load the bags on to it. But there was no way it would all fit, and they were talking about having to get a bus. They didnt have a car and the other gentleman had a walking stick. I was more than happy to help and they were really grateful. I often help people carry stuff out to their car but this was a first. I got some funny looks along the way but I really didnt mind. The good deed was photographed and uploaded to the areas Spotted Facebook page. More Ed Stubbs in the world please.

Article.title: Woman raped at her birthday party by friend’s ‘polite grandson’
Article.Description: 'As he dragged me from the kitchen I was petrified – I didn’t recognise him.'
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Monday 8 Jun 2015 1:41 pm Catherine Gwynne was raped on her birthday (Picture: PA) A mother has told how she was raped on her birthday by her friends polite grandson who she had invited to her party as a guest. Catherine Gwynne who has chosen to waive her right to anonymity to encourage other victims of sexual offences to come forward revealed how she was attacked by Arron Murphy, 23, shortly after hosting a meal to celebrate her 39th birthday. Ms Gwynne, who was friends with Murphys grandmother, had said goodbye to guests and was getting ready for bed when she heard someone in the kitchen. As she came through in her dressing gown he pounced on her, dragged her into her bedroom and raped her. Her young daughter, who is now ten, was sleeping just metres away. I thought his nan must have left something at the party and he had come back to get it for her, Ms Gwynne, now 40, said. I started to say hello but he launched himself on me. It was horrific. As he dragged me from the kitchen I was petrified I didnt recognise him. After raping Ms Gwynne, Murphy ran off. Arron Murphy has been jailed for seven years (Picture: PA) Mrs Gwynne called her boyfriend Shaun Phillips, 39, and he contacted police. Murphy was arrested the same evening on suspicion of rape but was released on bail. He was free to walk just metres from Ms Gwynnes home and went to the same pub as Mr Phillips. MORE: A woman stubbed her cigarette out on a reporters face He was tried at Cardiff Crown Court in September 2014 but the jury could not reach a verdict on a count of rape so it was sent for retrial. When I heard this I was absolutely disgusted, she continued. But it just made me more determined to achieve justice. Murphys grandmother lived in the same street as Ms Gwynne, and they had been close friends for three years when she told Ms Gwynne that her grandson was coming to stay with her. Ms Gwynne remembered: She was quite a bit older than me, but we hit it off. I saw her as a mother figure and my daughter McKenzie used to call her Nana. MORE: Is the MERS virus likely to reach the UK? How worried we should be as sixth person dies Wed go on holiday together, confide in one another. It was over a cuppa one day she told me that her grandson Arron had been having a tough time at home and was going to live with her for a while. She told me he was a bit of a wild child, so when I met him I was pleasantly surprised. He was polite, and I spent a lot of time with him and his grandma. Thats why I invited them both to my 39th birthday party. But now Murphy has been jailed for seven years and ordered to sign the sex offenders register for the rest of his life. Ms Gwynne says she can hold her head up high for reporting the crime and following through to see justice months later.

Article.title: World leaders look like they should be in The Sound of Music
Article.Description: The hiills areee aliveeee with the sound of Cameron
Article.MainBody: Nicholas Reilly for Metro.co.uk and Ben Nicholls for Metro.co.uk Monday 8 Jun 2015 1:04 pm (Picture: EPA/DANIEL KARMANN / POOL) THE HIIIIIILS ARE ALIIIIIVE WITH THE SOUND OF POLITICS. Thats the general vibe that were getting from this photo of the world leaders in attendance at the G7 summit which looks like something from a Von Trapp family portrait, and not a conference aiming to tackle some of humanitys biggest issues. The Hiiiiiiiills are aliiiive (Picture: EPA/Metro) But we cant help feeling that the line-up was too selective, featuring the likes of David Cameron, Barack Obama, Francois Hollande and Angela Merkel. It meant that we didnt get to see President Putin prove why hes the hunkiest despotin the world. Bow down to my horse (Picture: EPA/ Metro) And Kim-Jong Un wasnt given the opportunity to up the sartorial stakes with his new hipster trilby. Follow my fashions, hipsters (Picture: EPA/Metro) It also meant that a pretty hands-on approach to defence policy wasnt discussed. (Picture: EPA/Metro) And then it came to the actual workings of the would-be singing sensations, and it seemed that one man was intent on taking lead vocals G7 meme (Picture: EPA/Metro) But Angela Merkelwasnt happy about that, and threatened a Zayn Malik/Geri Halliwell/Robbie Williams departure from the political supergroup. WHY DOES THAT DISHFACE GET LEAD VOCALS? (Picture: EPA/MICHAEL KAPPELER / POOL) All together now

Article.title: Is the MERS virus likely to reach the UK? How worried we should be as sixth person dies
Article.Description: There has only ever been four confirmed cases of MERS in the UK.
Article.MainBody: Search Metro Follow us Is the MERS virus likely to reach the UK? How worried we should be as sixth persondies Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Monday 8 Jun 2015 12:58 pm Parts of South Korea have been in lock down since the outbreak (Picture:Getty Images) A sixth person has died after contracting the MERS virus in South Korea. A total of 87 people have been infected by Middle East Respiratory Syndrome also known as camel disease in the last month. The outbreak has closed around 1,870 schools and forced more than 2,000 people into isolation. An 80-year-old man, who tested positive for the virus last week while being treated for pneumonia, died Monday and became the countrys sixth death linked to MERS, according to a statement from the Health Ministry. Deputy Prime Minister Choi Kyung-hwan told a news conference Sunday that there was no reason to believe that the virus would significantly spread further in the country. The virus has no vaccine, and health experts say it spreads through close contact with infected people. (Picture:Getty Images) MERS emerged in 2012 and can be extremely serious It causessevere breathing difficulties, kidney failure and death But it is possible to be a carrier of the virus and have no symptoms The World Health Organization (WHO) states that 837 laboratory-confirmed cases of infection have been reported since 2012 It has a 30 per cent fatality rate and has been linked to291 deaths (Picture:Getty Images) A question mark hangs over how easily the virus is spread when airborne. In 2013 health experts detectedgenetic fragments from the MERS virus in an air sample from a camel barn in Saudi Arabia. Concerngrows that the virus may have mutated. But its fear of the unknown which is causing unrest among health experts. Hakim Djaballah, chief executive of Institute Pasteur Korea, toldThe Korea Times: There is no treatment for Mers. Since it is relatively a new virus, little drug discovery research has been done on it. South Korean President Park Geun-hye attends emergency meeting over (Picture: MERS EPA/YONHAP) The total number of laboratory confirmed cases detected in theUK remains at four, according to Gov.uk . The last known cases was in 2013. A little over a year ago two men brought the virus to the US from Saudi Arabia but neither passed it on. Stephen Morse, a professor of epidemiology at Columbia Universitys Mailman School of Public Health, told National Geographic he expects the virus to reappear in America again. He explained the best approach to tackle the virus is by not imposing travel restrictions this will only drive people to hide that they have MERS. More

Article.title: First haunting footage from inside capsized ship where 400 people died
Article.Description: In the harrowing footage, workers can be seen salvaging the ship in a bid to remove the items belonging to the ship’s tragic victims.
Article.MainBody: Nicholas Reilly for Metro.co.uk Monday 8 Jun 2015 12:18 pm This video shows the eerie wreckage of a cruise ship that capsized on the River Yangtze. More than 400 people have now been confirmed dead and 10 passengers remain unaccounted for. (Picture: Reuters/YouTube) But in the harrowing footage, workers can be seen salvaging the ship in a bid to remove the items belonging to the ships tragic victims. (Picture: AFP PHOTOSTR/AFP/Getty Images) Chinese authorities have said that the ship capsized on Monday after facing sudden severe winds, while the vessels captain remains in police custody. The death toll recently rose to 406, after bodies including that of a three-year-old girl were found on Friday and Saturday, while a further 36 passengers were reported missing. More

Article.title: A woman stubbed her cigarette out on a reporter’s face
Article.Description: The reporter was trying to interview a woman leaving court.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Monday 8 Jun 2015 10:45 am This is the shocking moment a woman stubs a cigarette out on a reporters face as she leaves court. Nine Network journalistAlex Bernhardt was trying to interview the friend of an accused murderer outsideCaboolture Court in Australia when the attack took place. Alex is heard gasping as the woman thrusts the butt onto the side of her face as she marches forward. She later tweeted about the incident. Just had a woman stub her lit cigarette into my face at Caboolture CourtCharming. Alex Bernhardt (@ABernhardt9) June 7, 2015 The journalist told the Mail Online that she didnt want to blow the attack out of proportion and was only left with a red mark that quickly healed. A Queensland Police spokesman said the alleged attacker was charged with public nuisance and will appear in court on July 23. Its not the first time Alex has been attacked by those shes attempted to interview. Take a look at this

Article.title: Student ‘accidentally’ buys teacher thong disguised as rose
Article.Description: This 12-year-old's game is strong.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Monday 8 Jun 2015 9:25 am Scrunched panties and roses are technically the same thing (Picture: imgur.com) Youve got to admire the nads on this student who accidentally bought his teacher a rose that turned out to be kinky undies. The teachers husband posted the photo on imgur.com and people are in absolute awe over the strength of this 12-year-olds game. He knew what he was doing. One imgur user commented: I do this ALL the time. Flowers. thongs. same thing.

Article.title: Everyone’s ogling this ridiculously hot policeman and there’s nothing wrong with that
Article.Description: *Dials 911 and pants heavily until arrested for wasting police time*
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Monday 8 Jun 2015 7:40 am DAYUM serve us up a piece of this hot man-meat. This is not just your average buff guy. Hes a police officer which makes his rippling figure more exotic because when you say law enforcement we automatically think of Dunkin Doughnuts and coffee. Not this one. Hes all about crunching 300 before work and chowing down on Whey Protein. Thats so hot. Oh yeah, thats the good stuff. Phwoar. ItsMiguel Pimentel, by the way. His name. But thats not important. More

Article.title: Earth will be obliterated by a giant asteroid in September, warn conspiracy theorists
Article.Description: Enjoy the summer, because mankind could end in September.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Monday 8 Jun 2015 7:14 am Bad news were afraid (Picture: Rex/Shuttershock) Septembers a rubbish month its the end of summer, for starters. Andthis year mankind could be totally obliterated by a giant asteroid.Itll probably rain too. Conspiracy theorists are predicting the end of time via terrifying blogs between September 22 and 28. The intense biblical types believe the event will spark a rapture with Hell on Earth. The most widely circulated theories are from those who believe were being set up by the man and the end of the world is all the Governments doing. But thankfully, science bods have reassured us that the event is highly unlikely. Yeah, just like this (Picture: Getty) A spokesperson for NASA said: NASA knows of no asteroid or comet currently on a collision course with Earth, so the probability of a major collision is quite small. In fact, as best as we can tell, no large object is likely to strike the Earth any time in the next several hundred years. Its worth noting that the majority of large objects that come crashing down to Earths atmosphere usually burn up on entry. More

Article.title: Pictured: Hundreds of migrants rescued by the Royal Navy off coast of Libya
Article.Description: Truly harrowing scenes.
Article.MainBody: (Picture: EPA/Crown Press) (Picture: EPA/Crown Press) Italian authorities investigating Libya-based smuggling operations say reliable intelligence is hard to come by, given Western diplomats have long left Libya, wracked by violence following the 2011 demise of Moammar Gadhafis regime. At the G-7 summit in Germany Sunday, British Prime Minister David Cameron said his nation would not walk on by when people were in danger. He said the summit will see discussion about how we try and put a Libyan government together as a way to combat the trafficking. European Union leaders have been grappling for a strategy to combat the traffickers in Libya. Germany, with two ships in the search-and-rescue mission Saturday, said four smuggler boats were destroyed after a total of 1,411 migrants were taken to safety. Rome-based investigators, meanwhile, are alleging systematic kickbacks for public contracts to feed and shelter migrants. Last week, 44 people, including local politicians from the centre-left to the centre-right in the Rome area, were arrested for alleged corruption. he probe examined contracts for social services, including for asylum-seekers at a migrant centre in Sicily. In intercepted phone calls, one suspect is heard referring to migrant shelters as a cow to milk for money. More

Article.title: Head transplants successful on mice – monkeys are next
Article.Description: A Chinese doctor, who has already clocked up 1,000 head transplants on mice, is now looking to perform this daring operation on monkeys.
Article.MainBody: Matt Payton for Metro.co.uk Sunday 7 Jun 2015 7:41 pm Xiaoping Ren has performed 1,000 head transplants on mice (Picture: Alamy) We are now getting ever closer to the reality of a being able to perform a head transplant. A Chinese doctor, who has already clocked up 1,000 head transplants on mice, is now looking to perform this controversialoperation on monkeys. Xiaoping Ren has been perfecting the complicated procedure on mice since 2013 according to the Wall Street Journal . The doctors researching this field have been labelled by critics asDr Frankensteins withProfessor Arthur Caplan, the Medical Ethics Professor at the New York University, saying simply: The whole idea is ridiculous. You may think there is no-one willing to be the first human guinea pig however a Russian computer scientist suffering from a genetic wasting disorder has thrown his cap into the ring. Valery Spiridonov, 30 (Picture: YouTube) Valery Spiridonov, 30, has said he wants his head transplanted by neurosurgeonDr Sergio Canavero onto a healthy body as early as next year. The MailOnline reported MrSpiridonovsaying: Am I afraid? Yes, of course I am. But it is not just very scary, but also very interesting. But you have to understand that I dont really have many choices. If I dont try this chance my fate will be very sad. With every year my state is getting worse. More

Article.title: Naked western tourists who ’caused earthquake’ are banned from leaving Malaysia
Article.Description: 'Local beliefs and customs are not to be disrespected.'
Article.MainBody: Matt Payton for Metro.co.uk Sunday 7 Jun 2015 7:17 pm Rescuers search for 17 people missing after Borneo earthquake(Picture: EPA) Tenwestern tourists who stripped naked on a sacred Malaysian mountain have been blamed for an earthquake that killed at least 13 people as a result they have been prohibited from leaving Malaysia. Mount Kinabalu in Borneois held as sacred by the localSabahan people and the Malaysian Tourist Minister has said the tourists are being detained in the country for disrespecting the mountain, according to the Digital Journal . Deputy Chief Minister of the Sabah region, Tan Sri Joseph Pairin Kitingan said: Whether other people believe this or not, its what we Sabahans believe. When the earthquake happened, its like a confirmation of our beliefs. There is almost certainly a connection. We have to take this as a reminder that local beliefs and customs are not to be disrespected. Rescuers search for 17 people missing after Borneo earthquake (Picture: EPA) There will be appeasement ceremony to the mountain after the search for missing people has been concluded. Five of the ten tourists have been identified as coming from Canada, Germany and the Netherlands. They were reported to the police by their guide who had protested their stripping down on sacred ground. More

Article.title: Nasa is trying to create eco-friendly (and quieter) supersonic passenger planes
Article.Description: They put a man on the moon, surely they can do this?
Article.MainBody: Oliver Wheaton for Metro.co.uk Sunday 7 Jun 2015 4:05 pm Ceoncept art for one of the supersonic planes (Picture: Nasa) Supersonic travel was seemingly relegated to science fiction after the last Concorde Flight in 2003, but now Nasa are hoping to bring it back to an everyday reality. However the days of Nasa simply wanting to go faster and faster are over, as they are now spending a reported $6million (3.9million) fundinggreener and cheaper supersonic travel. MIT received one of the grants from the space agency famous for putting the first human being on the moon. The Massachusetts-based university will be conducting research into the environmental effects of commercial supersonic travel, and studying how sonic booms (the pressure waves created when an object breaks the sound barrier) affect turbulence on passenger flights. Obviously many fighter jets currently have the ability to fly faster than the speed of sound, however this is not considered to have an especially large impact on the environment as there are far fewer fighter jets than commercial airliners.

Article.title: ‘Have a nice day’ – Escaped convicts leave note for prison officers
Article.Description: 200 police officers are now hunting down the two escaped murderers who have been described as 'extremely dangerous'
Article.MainBody: Matt Payton for Metro.co.uk Sunday 7 Jun 2015 2:28 pm The area where two convicted murderers used power tools to cut through steel pipes(Picture: New York State Governors office) Two escaping convicts left a note for baffled prisonofficers on a section of steel pipe they had crawled through to reachfreedom. The note read simply: Have a Nice Day. Police are now hunting the two convicted murderers who used power tools to breakout of the prison. The two prisoners used the tools to cut their way out of their cells before running and crawling along steel tunnels until they reached a manhole outside the prison walls. 200 police officers are involved in the manhunt ofDavid Sweat and Richard Mattwho had been servingtheir prison termsin neighbouring cells atClinton Correctional Facility in Dannemora, New York. New York Governor Andrew Cuomo has described themas extremely dangerous stating: Its very important that we locate these individuals. David Sweat (L) and Richard Matt (R) (Picture: New York State Police) The acting state corrections commissioner, Anthony Annuci, said: A search revealed that there was a hole cut out of the back of the cell through which these inmates escaped. They went onto a catwalk which is about six stories high. We estimate they climbed down and had power tools and were able to get out to this facility through tunnels, cutting away at several spots. To add to the cinematic nature of their escape, Governor Cuomo stated thatthe men had even arranged their beds so it looked like people were sleeping with these sweatshirt hoodies on The hole the two men escaped their cell through (Picture: New York State Governors office) Sweat, 34, had been sentenced to life imprisonment without parole for murdering a police officer in 2002. Matt, 48, was serving 25 years to life for three counts of murder including kidnapping, torturing and dismembering a man in 1997. The note left by the two convicts (Picture: New York State Governors office) More

Article.title: Man who allegedly robbed house of woman, 101, ‘raped her as an afterthought’
Article.Description: He reportedly told detectives that had he planned the sexual assault he would have brought a condom.
Article.MainBody: Harry Readhead for Metro.co.uk Saturday 6 Jun 2015 8:49 pm Pettis reportedly told police he would have brought a condom had he planned the alleged rape (Picture: Milwaukee County Sheriffs Office) A man has been charged withrapinga pensioner during a burglary of her home. Antoine Devon Pettis, from Milwaukee, Wisconsin, was tracked down through DNA evidence and arrestedfor allegedly breaking into the home of a 101-year-old and then raping her after finding her in bed. The Milwaukee Journal-Sentinel reports that the man told police he hadnt planned to rape the woman, and did so as an afterthought. He reportedlytold detectives that had he planned the sexual assault he would have brought a condom. The victim was taken to hospital for her injuries. Pettis, who waswanted for failing to appear in a 2013 drug case, is being held in the jail. He could face up to 55 years in prison if convicted of sexual assault, aggravated battery and burglary. More

Article.title: Disabled-accessible orgy given green light
Article.Description: 'A wheelchair can become just a big sex toy,' said Andrew Morrison-Gurza.
Article.MainBody: Harry Readhead for Metro.co.uk Saturday 6 Jun 2015 8:12 pm The Buddies in Bad Times Theatre will host the event (Picture: Google) Toronto will host its first ever accessible orgy for the disabled in what has been called the coming down of the Berlin Wall of sex for people with disabilities. Stella Palikarova, who uses a wheelchair because she has spinal muscular dystrophy, says she is one of thousands of people tired of being assumed to have something wrong with their libido because of their disability. So the 35-year-old, who works as a disability awareness consultant, has comeup with an idea. An ideawhich, she believes,will bring down the Berlin Wall of sex for people with disabilities. An orgy. Ms. Palikarova has teamed up with theBuddies in Bad Times Theatre, a venue whichhas space for125 including around20 wheelchairs, plus walkers and canes for the event, which is called Deliciously Disabled. Tickets will be $20 for everyone except personal support workers, who get in free. Stella says there is a pervasive myth that disabled people have something wrong with their libido (Picture: Getty Images) There will be hydraulic lifts,an interpreter for the deaf, and people who are not disabled are also welcome, the Toronto Sun reports. Ifyoure shy, the orgys theme is masquerade ball, so you can throw on your mask and no-one will know who you are.The date of the event is 14 August. Awheelchair can become just a big sex toy, Andrew Morrison-Gurza, a co-organiser who has cerebral palsy, told the Toronto Sun . Ms. Palikarova added: The naysayers are just subconsciously hating the fact that people in wheelchairs are having great sex -better sex than a lot of people are having. By making this party accessible, we are saying openly that people with disabilities are sexual beings and not only in more conventional ways. More

Article.title: China has deployed ‘anti-cheating’ drones for exams
Article.Description: China's 'gaokao' exam has been dubbed 'the most pressure-packed exam in the world'.
Article.MainBody: Harry Readhead for Metro.co.uk Saturday 6 Jun 2015 6:56 pm The drones can intercept radio signals and find their source (Picture: Getty Images) Every year in China, millions of students sit an exam so stressful that it has been linked to sudden illness and even suicide. So the terrified young people preparing to take the gaokao dubbed the most pressure-packed examination in the world will be pleased to know that they will now have anti-cheating drones hovering abovethem as they work. The two-day exam is said to be so important to a young Chinese persons future prospects that in practical terms it determines the course of their entire lives. Because of its importance, cheating has become common. And when we say cheating, we dont mean scribbling some notes on theinside of your shirt cuff. The gaokao has been linked to suicides (Picture: Getty Image) Some of the cheating equipment these students have used in recent yearslooks straight out of Q Branch. One such item involved using a pen to take a photo of the test which was then sent to a remote location, answered, and then read back to the student via an in-ear receiver. To tackle this high-tech trickery, Wired reports that the Luoyang Radio Authority has deployed anti-cheating drones which can identify radio signals and their source. The drone will hover roughly 500m above the test site and has an interception range of around 1km. The drone can also be controlled by exam staff using tablets. They can fly the drone lower and closer to suspicious students for greater accuracy. We advise those people with ulterior motives as early as possible to give up trying to cheat in examinations via radio means, said Zeng Ying Yong, secretary of the LRA. More

Article.title: A woman with terminal metastatic breast cancer is educating people on how to react
Article.Description: There is no cure.
Article.MainBody: Amy Willis for Metro.co.uk Saturday 6 Jun 2015 5:11 pm This is Holley Kitchena mother-of-two from Cedar Park, Texas. When Holley was 39, she was diagnosed with stage 3 breast cancer. She underwent a double mastectomy, chemo and radiation therapy. Aftera year of treatment, she believed she was cancer free. She believed the battle was over. Itwasnt. Holley was diagnosed withmetastatic stage 4 breast cancer, meaning cancer cells from her breast tissue had entered her blood stream and started growing on her spine and bones. There is no cure. Holleystreatment will never end. The disease is terminal and she is likely to only live for another 26 months. Around 40,000 people die from metastatic breast cancer every year. But what would you say to someone you knew, if they told you they had been diagnosed with terminal cancer? This? Even this? No. Sometimes its ok to say nothing at all or even thatyou are praying for them (and then actually do it). Holleys mission now is to educate people about what to say to people with metastatic breast cancer, which is why she created this video on YouTube. She says: I think it resonates with people because its honest. Its what people dont want to say what people dont want to hear.I was hoping to reach a thousand people just for a little bit of education which is now my mission. We pray for you and your family Holley. We really do. More

Article.title: Now this is one big bug: Say hello to the Giant Weta
Article.Description: You would not want to wake up to this on your pillow.
Article.MainBody: Matt Payton for Metro.co.uk Saturday 6 Jun 2015 5:04 pm You would not want to wake up to this on your pillow. TheGiant Weta is a flightless member of the cricket family that originates from New Zealand and is the heaviest insect in the world. Not counting antennae and limbs, the Giant Weta can grow up to 10cm and weigh in at 35g. How did this massive bug come into existence and why can it not fly? Well, asNew Zealand hasno indigenous territorial mammals and isa remote island, there was no need for the Weta orbirds such as the Kiwi birdto fly away from ground-based predators. The size of the Giant Weta is a result of the greater amount of oxygen available 300 400 million years ago as opposed to now as, Wired reports. Insects breath through holes in their exoskeleton which limits their growth but with prehistoric oxygen levels the Weta was able to evolve to its current gigantic size. No one likes a big creepy crawly, so sleep well. So cutewell maybe not (Picture: YouTube) More

Article.title: ‘Human Ken doll’ dies months after being diagnosed with cancer
Article.Description: The 20-year-old had spent £30,000 on plastic surgery
Article.MainBody: Matt Payton for Metro.co.uk Saturday 6 Jun 2015 5:00 pm The Brazilian Human Ken (Picture: YouTube) A young manknown as the human Ken doll died ofcomplications fromleukaemiafive months after being diagnosed with the disease. 20-year-old Brazilian model Celso Santebaes had spent 30,000 on cosmetic procedures to look more like Barbies boyfriend, Ken. He died from pneumonia at the Federal University of Uberlndia Clinical Hospital in south eastern Brazil. After being diagnosed in January, Santebaes spoke of a changed focus in his life, telling the Latin Times : For me that [my looks] doesnt matter. What matter is my health now, and I will fight for it. He had first foundfame aged 16 on a TV chatshow andwent on to win various modelling contests. Before his death, MrSantebaes was earning up to 10,000 for a single public appearance and had a range of toy dolls based on him. His father, Celia Borges, told reporters: When he was starting to fulfil his dreams, he discovered his illness and his dreams were interrupted. He had plans but God had others. More

Article.title: Isis ‘likely to be able to build chemical weapons’, Australia says
Article.Description: Daesh is likely to have amongst its recruits the technical expertise necessary to build chemical weapons.'
Article.MainBody: Harry Readhead for Metro.co.uk Saturday 6 Jun 2015 4:04 pm Isis is likely to have the technical expertise and materials required for chemical weapons, Bishop said (Picture: PA) Terror group Isis is likely to have the materials and technical expertiserequired to buildchemical weapons, Australias foreign minister has claimed. Speaking in Perth, Australia, Julie Bishop voiced concerns about the Islamic States recruitment of well-trained engineers and chemists, saying it could indicate more serious efforts in their development of weapons. And Ms. Bishop went onto say that it was likely that Isis now had both the materials and the technical expertise required to build chemical weapons should they wish to do so. The use of chlorine by Daesh [an Arabic term for ISIS], and its recruitment of highly technically trained professionals, including from the west, have revealed far more serious efforts in chemical weapons development, Ms. Bishop said. Australian foreign minister Julie Bishop was speaking in Perth (Picture: Getty Images) Daesh is likely to have amongst its tens of thousands of recruits the technical expertise necessary to further refine precursor materials and build chemical weapons. The claims came after Kurdish officials came under attack from an Isis suicide bomber driving a lorryfilled with chlorine gas, which is a banned chemical under the 1997 Chemical Weapons Convention. Though Kurdish peshmerga destroyed the lorry with a rocket before the militant coulddetonate it, a number of fighters complained of nausea, vomiting, dizziness and weakness as a result of the chlorine, RT reports. A fact-finding mission in Syria by the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons last year found that chlorine was being usedsystematically and repeatedly. More

Article.title: This is what happened when a woman catcalled men
Article.Description: Warning: Plot twist
Article.MainBody: Amy Willis for Metro.co.uk Saturday 6 Jun 2015 3:49 pm (warning: naughty language) A couple of women decided theyd give men a chance to know how it feels to be catcalled. So actress and comedian Soojeong Son started pacing up and down the streets of New York randomly whispering *sweet* nothings to various unsuspecting male victims. There was this guy This poor fella And thispoor man Sons partner in crime meanwhile filmed the whole thing for the social experiment and then posted the results on YouTube. So what was the result? How did men feel about being catcalled by women? *Plot twist*

Article.title: Scientists grow limb in laboratory for the first time
Article.Description: It could open the door to whole-limb human transplants.
Article.MainBody: Jimmy Nsubuga for Metro.co.uk Saturday 6 Jun 2015 3:01 pm Scientists have managed to grow a limb in a laboratory for the first time ever, which could openthe door to whole-limb human transplants. While it was only a rats forearm that scientists managed to grow, the breakthrough from Massachusetts General Hospital could lead to human limbsbeing developed in the future. The experts at Harald Otts lab used the decellularization/recellularization technique to produce the body part according to New Scientist . It involved getting rid of the cells of a dead rodents arm and then regrowing them. After rats, scientists hope to move on to primates (Picture: Getty Images) The new limbwas only able to flex if stimulated electrically. The next stepwill be to get a rat to move the new body part by itself, andhopefully a primate will be next successful subject. This is science fiction coming to life, lung regeneration expert Daniel Weiss told the Standard Daily . Its a very exciting development, but the challenge will be to create a functioning limb. More

Article.title: ‘Female Viagra’ pill has now been approved – good times for all
Article.Description: PS. It's not Viagra - it actually increases sexual desire not just boost blood flow to the genitals
Article.MainBody: Metro News Reporter for Metro.co.uk Saturday 6 Jun 2015 12:40 pm DO you want the urge back? (Picture: Getty Images) There is a drug on the way designed to help women recover the magic. FDA approval has been finally given to a pill designed that increase the psychological desire for sex in women. Nicknamed female Viagra, Flibanserindoes not simply send blood to the genitals like actual Viagra- it is taken daily and targets two neuro-transmitters in the brain associated with sexual desire. Bat Sheva Marcus, a sexual dysfunction specialist, told Business Insider : I see this all the time where a woman, she enjoys sex and gets aroused and orgasms, but she absolutely just doesnt want it anymore shes just not interested. Its something thats going on in the brain. Its trying to change the parts of the brain that dont light up, the ones that arent responding. The running issue with Flibanserinhas been its side effectswhich include fainting and drowsiness especially when taken with alcohol. In addition, the effectiveness of the drug has been questioned with trial participants taking the drughad on average only one more satisfied sexual episode than those taking a placebo. More

Article.title: If famous authors sent drunken texts…
Article.Description: Oh Roald Dahl, you wag
Article.MainBody:
Matt Payton for Metro.co.uk Saturday 6 Jun 2015 11:01 am Dan Brown (Picture: Paris Review) We have all sent drunken texts incomprehensible at best and toe-curlingly embarrassing at worst. So, the obvious question is what the greatest writers of the last few centuries would text after a few too many pinot grigios at the local All Bar One. From William Wordsworth to Roald Dahl toSamuel Beckett writer Jessie Gaynor has created these wholly believable drunken texts for the Paris Review . So enjoy these comic parodies starting with the 18th author of the hymn Jerusalem and the poem Daffodils. William Wordsworth Everyone loves poetry(Picture: Paris Review)
Ever seen one of his plays? Not a lot happensat all(Picture: Paris Review)
Roald Dahlwould blatantly be a great drinking companion(Picture: Paris Review)
Philip Roth As all Roh fans will tell you he does like to write about masturbationa lot(Picture: Paris Review)
Gertrude Stein Having hung out with Hemingway in Paris Stein must have liked a few brewskis (Picture: Paris Review)
If he wrote drunk would his prose be better (Picture: Paris Review) More

Article.title: Breast cancer sufferer’s response to #HoldaCokeWithYourBoobsChallenge is perfect
Article.Description: She wasn't impressed by the campaign at all.
Article.MainBody: A photo posted by Serena Treccani (@zahreno) on May 29, 2015 at 11:21am PDT Dozens of women wereposting selfies of their breasts squeezed together holdinga bottle of coke this week. The challengewas to balance thecoke somehow obscuring your nipples at the same time toraise awareness of breast cancer. In theory. The craze, which was compared to the ALS Ice Bucket Challenge, took off under the hashtag #HoldaCokeWithYourBoobsChallenge and quickly went viral. A photo posted by (@pzdc_jpg) on Jun 1, 2015 at 3:00am PDT A photo posted by Stefano Corti (@stefanocorti85) on May 28, 2015 at 7:44am PDT Acouple of days later the owner of an adult talent spotting agency called Elite Talent Referral revealed that it had all started off as a joke. MORE: Stop taking photos of your breasts now man behind craze says it was a JOKE Danny Frost, the man behind the craze, said his company just went with it after the campaign took off. A photo posted by Danny Frost (@danfrost43) on Jun 1, 2015 at 8:53pm PDT There were criticisms of the new craze, with many upset that it was makingcancer appear sexy. One of those who was appalled by the challengewas Aimee Fletcher, who was diagnosed with breast cancer a year ago. Aimee Fletcher (@aimeefletch82) March 17, 2015 Aimee, who is 32 and runs a blog called The Ultimate C Word , hasrecently been diagnosed with bone metastasis meaning cancer cells from thecancer had entered her blood stream and started growing on her bones. Just ripped off any eyebrows ive managed to grow back #ChristmasChemoBrow #steroidface @YBCN_UK pic.twitter.com/Hs2fi4vITW Aimee Fletcher (@aimeefletch82) December 24, 2014 She first saw the challenge as she attended the funeral of a friend who had died from breast cancer. Aimeesaid she is sick of stunts that see cancer as a game rather than the reality of it. She told Buzzfeed: Cancer is not fun and sexy. The treatment is gruelling its not glamorous and why people decided to take photos of the part of the body that breast cancer destroys is beyond me. Now Aimee has her own response to the campaign. Her own #HoldaCokeWithYourBoobsChallenge contribution. and here it is: Aimee Fletcher (@aimeefletch82) June 4, 2015 Perfect.

Article.title: Minnie Mouse and Hello Kitty had a full-on brawl in Times Square
Article.Description: We know cats and mice are natural enemies, but still...
Article.MainBody: Harry Readhead for Metro.co.uk Friday 5 Jun 2015 7:59 pm Minnie Mouse and Hello Kitty got arrested. The mascots had to pull together and have a family meeting. pic.twitter.com/uwp6R1L1nf Jake Rullman (@jakerullman) June 4, 2015 It isnt every day you see Minnie Mouse and Hello Kitty duking it out in one of the worlds most iconic places. But thats exactly what happened today in New Yorks Times Square. And thoughwe are well awarethat cats and mice are natural enemies,we didnt know that this was also the case for humans dressed as cats and mice. In any case,the costumed characters came to blows. BothSandra Mocha, 34, of Queens, and Giovanna Melendez, 40, of New Jersey were restrained, detained and then charged with assault. This is another reason why we need regulations to address the growing problems in Times Square, Tim Tompkins, president of the Times Square Alliance, told the New York Daily News . More

Article.title: Villagers brutally beaten for 9 HOURS after stealing and killing dogs
Article.Description: The brutal attack didn't even stop when police arrived.
Article.MainBody: Nicholas Reilly for Metro.co.uk Friday 5 Jun 2015 7:08 pm Warning: Graphic images The thieves were brutally tortured for nine hours (Picture: CEN) Dog thieves in a Chinese village were beatenfor nine hours by an angry mob and then had thecarcasses of the dead animals tied around their necks. When police arrived to rescue the thieves, the village vigilantes turned their anger on the authorities too, assaulting them with metal bars and smashing their patrol car. The attack took place at roughly 7am on Tuesday in Shaping village, Hunan province, after two thieves were caught with dead dogsthat they are believed to have killed for meat. But an angry mob soon took justice into their own hands, givingthe thievesan unrelenting nine-hour beatingand then tying the dogs bodies around their necks, with their bottoms pointed towards their noses. (Picture: CEN) When police arrived to take the suspects to a nearby station, villagers stopped them and demanded a sum of 1 million Yuan (106,000) compensation to secure the pairs release. They then decided to attack the police, and werent persuaded to stop the attack when they were warned that mob justice was against the law. The mob eventually calmed down when authorities from the local Public Security Bureau arrived on the scene, with the two suspects being taken into police custody. However, the mob could also face criminal proceedings with several of the villagers reportedly guilty of illegal imprisonment, assault and obstructing police work. More

Article.title: Dirty street justice sees homeless ‘flasher’ tipped over in portable toilet
Article.Description: The incident was filthy in all regards.
Article.MainBody: Jimmy Nsubuga for Metro.co.uk Friday 5 Jun 2015 6:57 pm Wow this is a 1st for me. Guy was tipped over while in a honeybucket. He's covered in feces. @KGWNews pic.twitter.com/sHunjnr3pu Ashley Korslien (@AshleyKorslien) June 4, 2015 This is probably the dirtiest street justice weve ever seen. It involved an alleged flasher getting tipped over in a portable toilet, which led to him being covered in waste. The incident, which was filthy in all regards, happened yesterday morning in Portland, Oregon, according to SergeantPete Simpson. Apasserbytook a snap of the aftermath thatshowed theHoney Bucket toilet on its side, with the flasherapparently in it. An anonymous homeless person approached the police and said that the man had been inside the porta-potty with his pants around his ankles, holding the door open as he pleasured himself, he told wusa9.com . The person told the police that other homeless people were tired of his behaviour, so they knocked over the porta-potty and ran away. The unnamed man wasnt injured but his pride must have taken a hit. The culprits who shoved the toilet over have not been found and the alleged flasher was not arrested. More

Article.title: US student who carried mattress after claiming she was raped releases violent sex tape
Article.Description: She can be heard protesting and whimpering in pain.
Article.MainBody: Nicole Morley for Metro.co.uk Friday 5 Jun 2015 5:07 pm Emma with her dorm mattress (Picture: Getty) She claims the disturbingfootage isnt a recreation of the alleged rape. Emma Sulkowicz, the artist and activist who carried around her mattress in protest against Columbia University after they refused to expel a male student she claimed raped her, has released another piece of performance art. The website Ceci Nest Pas Un Viol hosts Emmas latest video offering. The eight-minute clip shows her engaging in what looks to be consensual sex which turns violent with a man whose face is blurred out. The man slaps and strangles her, removes the condom before resuming extremely rough sex with Sulkowicz, who is protesting and whimpering in pain. Disturbing(Picture: Emma Sulkowicz) Sulkowicz alleged that fellow Columbia University student Paul Nungesser raped her in August 2012, leading to the conception of Mattress Performance (Carry That Weight), which became her senior thesis. On the Ceci Nest Pas Un Viol host website, she explains the footage isnt a recreation of the supposed incident. The accompanying text reads: Do you think Im the perfect victim or the worlds worst victim? Do you refuse to see me as either a human being or a victim? If so, why? Is it to deny me agency and thus further victimise me? Sulkowicz adds: If you watch this video without my consent, then I hope you reflect on your reasons for objectifying me and participating in my rape, for in that case, were you the one who couldnt resist the urge to make Ceci Nest Pas Un Viol about what you wanted to make it about: rape. She denies its a recreation (Picture: Emma Sulkowicz)

Article.title: Female UFC fighter Leslie Smith just beat an apology of a man who grabbed her friend’s bum
Article.Description: 'I just dropped elbows on him from mount against the building until he started saying, "I'm sorry"'.
Article.MainBody: Search Metro Follow us Female UFC fighter Leslie Smith just beat an apology of a man who grabbed her friendsbum Harry Readhead for Metro.co.uk Friday 5 Jun 2015 4:56 pm Smith beat an apology out of the man (Picture: Getty Images) A female UFC fighter taught aman a lesson in manners after hegroped one of her friends. Bantamweight Leslie Smith and strawweight Heather Clark were standing outside a San Francisco club with a group of friends when a man grabbed the behind of one of the women. Smith instantly confronted the man, who has not been identified, saying Hey, you cant do that. But as if the mans initial actwasnt bad enough, he then spat in Smiths face. F*** you. I can do whatever he want, he told her. Smith fights in the bantamweight division ofthe UFC (Picture: Getty Images) Smith replied: No motherf***er, you cant. Then the man swung. Bad idea. Smith slipped the punch, drove the man back into a wall andtook him to the floor. Then she started raining down elbows on him. He turned over and I just dropped elbows on him from mount against the building until he started saying, Im sorry, Smith told Bloody Elbow . Then I stopped as soon as he said sorry, because that was really the only thing I went over there for. Smith made headlines last year when she nearly lost an ear in a fight (Picture: Getty Images) Smith said she that she initially wanted to the keep the incident quiet, but has changed her mind. It has given my friend and all of my female friends so much pleasure to know that happened, she said. Its not an unusual thing for a woman, a good-looking woman in public to get grabbed and fondled by strangers. At first, I was trying to keep the whole thing on the down low and not say anything about it, but after seeing how happy it has made so many women, I changed my mind. We suspect the man in question may keep his hands to himself in future. More

Article.title: How embarrassing – Police car gets stuck in sinkhole
Article.Description: The police vehicle has continued to sink further and further underground.
Article.MainBody: Matt Payton for Metro.co.uk Friday 5 Jun 2015 4:19 pm A police officer found himself and his 44 police vehicle at the bottom of a sinkhole while driving along the street. Not exactly the best start to hisFriday morning. The emergency responderat the police station cant havebelieved his at first until the pictures started comingin. MORE: 35 foot deep sinkhole opens up on golf course Sgt. Greg Miller of the Sheridan Police Department in Denver, Colorado, experienced this odd phenomenon this morning. Luckily he escaped with only cuts and bruises telling 7NEWS : I realise Im in a sinkhole, all I see is dirt around me. Sgt. Greg Millers SUV in the sinkhole (Picture: abc7) He added: When it happened and I realised I was in the hole, I just basically had to crawl through the window. Grabbed hold of the rail on the top of the roof, then pulled myself on top of the roof. Then I jumped up and grabbed on the top of the pavement and pulled myself out. The police vehicle has continued to sink further and further underground. If only it was the criminals that fell into sinkholes not the cops. More

Article.title: This video proves just how easy it is for someone to slip drugs in your drink
Article.Description: This proves that you should be extremely vigilant
Article.MainBody: Nicholas Reilly for Metro.co.uk Friday 5 Jun 2015 4:14 pm This video shows the scary reality of just how easy it is to have drugs slipped into your drink while youre out with friends. In the video, YouTuber Joey Salads proves that you should be extremely vigilant, as he manages to subtly slip rohypnol into a drink, while the person guzzling the beverage is blissfully unaware. (Picture: YouTube/Joey Salads) As he first succeeds in slipping the pill, its the fault of unobservant friends who arent paying full attention after they promise to watch a pals drink while she goes to the loo. But then it gets a little scarier as he drops a pill into a girls drink while talking to her, seemingly proving that looking away for a split second is all it takes for the crime to occur. Terrifying but hugely insightful.

Article.title: Ireland just took another step towards equality with new transgender laws
Article.Description: Ireland and Denmark will be the only two European countries which legally allow people to change their gender without medical support.
Article.MainBody: Oliver Wheaton for Metro.co.uk Friday 5 Jun 2015 4:11 pm (Picture: Getty Images) Ireland is fast becoming one of the most progressive countries in Europe after it was announced that trans people will be allowed to self report their gender. Currently transgender people in Ireland have to go through medical and even psychological testing to have their preferred gender recognised. These new measures, which will come intoforce next month, come shortly after the country voted to allow same sex marriage. Irish media have reported howthe move will make it easier for transgender people to get married and update official documents such as passports and driving licenses. The new rules will not be extended to anyone below the age of 18 however. MORE:Womens genes could be influencing when they start having children Next month Ireland and Denmark will be the only two European countries which legally allow people to change their gender without medical support. Irelands deputy prime minister Joan Burton said: A person who transitions gender will have their preferred gender fully recognised by the State for all purposes including the right to marry or enter a civil partnership in the preferred gender and the right to a new birth certificate. The move has been supported bySinn Fin,withMEP Lynn Boylan calling apersons gender identity a matter for each individual. Transgender people know their own identity. They dont need medical evaluation to prove their identity to anyone, she added. More

Article.title: Gang-raped at gunpoint in front of her dad – but this woman refuses to be broken
Article.Description: TRIGGER WARNING: Contains upsetting material.
Article.MainBody: Nicole Morley for Metro.co.uk Friday 5 Jun 2015 3:07 pm Jes and her father on her wedding day (Picture: PA Real Life) She refuses to let the attack dictate her future. A gun-wielding gang took it in turns to rape Jes Foord, 28, seven years ago. The men approached while Jes was walking her dog near her home in Waterfall, South Africa. When I saw the men I assumed they would rob us, Mrs Foord, who has since married, said. But they tied my father to a tree and held a knife to his throat while the others took it in turns to rape me. They were urging each other on and jeering. One ripped off my shorts while the other held a blade to my neck.One by one. I thought it would never stop. Following the traumatic attack, Mrs Foordtookmedication similar to that of cancer sufferers to prevent the risk of contracting HIV. The drugs made her hair fall out and she was sick for weeks, she recalled: I had to take the morning after pill, plus TB and STD medication. Determined to seek justice, Mrs Foordgaveevidence against the men who mocked her in court. The rapists didnt laugh for long, as they were sentenced to a combined 107 years jail time. MORE: Gay teen raped by his own mother to cure homosexual tendencies Happy families (Picture: PA Real Life) Mrs Foord told how her father walked her down the aisle at her wedding to Jonathan, 28, in 2011and sheand her husband had twins, Layla and Daniel, in 2014. Conviction rates are notoriously low in South Africa, so to encourage other rape victims to come forward, Mrs Foord waived her right to anonymity. When it happened, I decided I wasnt going to let it control me. They took something from me, but the rest of my life is mine. At first, I wasnt sure I made the right decision. But I started getting letters from well-wishers and I knew it was important.

Article.title: Women’s genes could be influencing when they start having children
Article.Description: The average first-time mother is now aged between 28 and 29 - four years later than the average in 1970.
Article.MainBody: Oliver Wheaton for Metro.co.uk Friday 5 Jun 2015 12:29 pm Mother kissing her baby boy. (Picture: Getty) Womens genes could be determining when they start having children. Research by Oxford University found a 15 per cent variance between the ages women have their first baby, and they think its all down to genetics. The average first-time mother is now aged between 28 and 29 four years later than the average in 1970. However this is due to societal factors such as more women deciding to delay starting a family to focus on their career. The researchers looked at women in the UK and the Netherlands, and found that women who had children at a younger age shared one particular gene. MORE: Prince Harry is knighted (by his own grandmother) Interestingly they also found that women who gave birth at a younger age tended to go on to have larger families. While this may seem like yet another blow to women who are wish to have babies at a later stage in their lives, the researchers claim this is actually beneficial as it potentially means one day women will be able to analyse their genes to find out when their optimal time for having children is. Natural selection is not just a historical process. Modern societies are still evolving today, with early fertility patterns being an inherited reproductive advantage, the researchers said in a press release.

Article.title: Facebook refuses to remove video showing ‘child abuse’, claiming it is ‘baby yoga’
Article.Description: Warning: Distressing content.
Article.MainBody: MORE: Qatar defy reports and claim not a single worker has died in World Cup construction By the end of the babys ordeal it is no longer moving or screaming, leading many to believe it has suffered brain damage or even died. An NSPCC spokesman said: We obviously have deep concerns for the baby and would hope that Facebook does all in its power to help trace whoever was responsible for this appalling incident. Its difficult to understand why such a dreadful film should have been posted and why Facebook allowed it to be viewed. Our main concern is for the welfare of the baby but there has to be more control over the kind of material that is posted on social media sites and we will be talking to Facebook as a matter of urgency. However Facebook have refused to remove it, claiming the women featured in the videoare actually practising baby yoga with the child. A Facebook spokesperson said: We do not allow child abuse on Facebook and any illegal content which is flagged to us is quickly removed. Whilst we understand that people may be upset by this video which depicts a form of baby yoga, after careful review we found it does not break our rules. Update: Facebook have released the following statement concerning the sharing of the video on the site. Like others, we find the behaviour in this video upsetting and disturbing. In cases like these, we face a difficult choice: balancing peoples desire to raise awareness of behaviour like this against the disturbing nature of the video. In this case, we are removing any reported instances of the video from Facebook that are shared supporting or encouraging this behaviour. In cases where people are raising awareness or condemning the practice, we are marking reported videos as disturbing, which means they have a warning screen and are accessible only to people over the age of 18.

Article.title: Killer ‘wave’ approaching abandoned beach photo isn’t as deadly as it looks
Article.Description: It's not actually a wave, or mountain.
Article.MainBody: Jimmy Nsubuga for Metro.co.uk Friday 5 Jun 2015 11:42 am This deadly wave isnt that deadly (Picture: Facebook / Sea Girt Beach Patrol) Theyre not mountains, or even waves, its actually thick fog. If you were standing on the beach and saw this when you looked out to the ocean youd probably would think you were about to die. Either that or a mountain range had just mysteriously sprung up in the distance. Its getting closer (Picture: Facebook/ Sea Girt Lifeguards) Both suggestions would bewrong though. The massive wave/mountain in Sea Girt, New Jersey, was actually just fog. The image was still frightening to look at though and has been unnerving social media users ever since it was posted up on Monday by lifeguards who patrol the beach.

Article.title: ‘Leaked Barclays email’ proves banking IS The Wolf of Wall Street
Article.Description: You must wear suspenders and bring a pillow to your desk.
Article.MainBody: Ollie McAteer for Metro.co.uk Thursday 4 Jun 2015 10:15 pm (Picture: Paramount Pictures) The aggressive banking culture you saw in The Wolf of Wall Street is still very much alive today, if this email is anything to go by. It was sent byJustin Kwan, a second-year analyst in Barclays BankGlobal Power & Utilities group in New York City, and its a terrifying insight into the rules all juniors must abide by throughout their summer internship. The in-house laws include having a spare tie so your boss can wipe his dirty hands on it, being the last to leave every night and bringing a pillow to your desk. Check them out: A spokesperson for Barclays said: Barclays is fully committed to creating an environment where both our bankers and our business can thrive. We have implemented policies and training guidelines to enable employees to gain valuable experience while at the same time maintaining a healthy work-life balance.

Article.title: New ‘giant’ telescope will let us see further than we’ve ever seen before
Article.Description: 'It will reveal the first objects to emit light in the universe, explore the mysteries of dark energy and dark matter.'
Article.MainBody: Matt Payton for Metro.co.uk Thursday 4 Jun 2015 9:28 pm The Giant Magellan Telescope (GMT) will be the biggest Earth-based optical telescope ever built (Picture:GMTO) Work has begun on the worlds most powerful telescope costing more than325 million. The Giant Magellan Telescope is beingbuilt inLas Campanas in the Atacama desert in northern Chile where the lack of pollution and high altitude gives the best vantage of the stars. MORE: Astronomers find the biggest thing in the universe and its pretty weird Wendy Freedman, chair of the Giant Magellan Telescope Organization (GMTO) and professor of astronomy and astrophysics at University of Chicago said: The GMT will herald the beginning of a new era in astronomy. It will reveal the first objects to emit light in the universe, explore the mysteries of dark energy and dark matter, and identify potentially habitable planets in the Earths galactic neighborhood. The decision by the GMTO partner institutions to start construction is a crucial milestone on our journey to making these amazing discoveries using state-of-the-art science, technology and engineering. It will be based in the Atacama desert in Northern Chile (Picture: GMTO) To give context, this new telescope will produce images 10 times the quality currently provided by the Hubble Space Telescope.
